loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 26-year-old woman who is single with one child. She has a small bingo business to earn a living. She has two years with this business. Elisapeta needs a loan to buy a bingo machine, bingo playing papers, bingo bottles, chairs, tables and a new white board. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Elisapeta became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, bingo playing papers, bingo bottles, chairs, tables and a new white board.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and make new decorations for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Faaoo

texts.en:
Faaoo is 58 years old and single with 2 children. 

She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Faaoo has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Ez  Al- Den

texts.en:
Ez Al- Den is a 29-year-old married man and a father of only one child. He lives with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He is a university graduate. Due to high rates of the unemployment in the country, Ez Al- Den couldn't find a job to look after of his family. The working opportunities in the country these days have become very limited and few. Due to that, Ez Al- Den is one of many of Yemeni youth people who have a university education, but they can not find jobs to look after of their family. Ez Al- Den doesn't surrender to that condition, but strives strongly to go ahead to improve the living condition of his family. He is a talented and responsible professional young man. He has a high determination inside himself to go ahead to make a secure future for his child. From this side, he decided to start his own business. He purchased a minibus to drive as a transport service. He drives people from one station to another inside the capital city of Sana'a to earn the money for his family. Ez Al- Den thinks this business is very profitable for him, and he can earn a lot of money. Unfortunately, he doesn't have any amount of money to start his own business. For this reason,  Ez- Al- Den is requesting a youth loan of 1,800,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a minibus to work as a driver to earn money that will help him in improve the living standards of his family. He thinks this business is very profitable for him. Through this business,  Ez Al- Den can save a lot of money that will help him in cover all the expenses of the family.

Ez Al –Den looks forward to purchasing other buses and renting them with a monthly salary to provide his family with a better future. He hopes to open a savings account in AMB and send his child to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for his transportation business.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep with his wife and their two children live in Tasikmalaya, a small city located about an hour from Bandung. Asep runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and provides a utility bill payment service. 

Asep joined Ruma because he wants to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process  more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan will help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently will support his plans to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en:
Neneng, her husband, and their only child live in Tasikmalaya, a small city located about an hour from Bandung. Neneng manages a small shop that sells school and office supplies such as stationary, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payments. 

She was introduced to Ruma when one of Ruma's agents visited her shop. She quickly decided to join Ruma because she wanted to try out mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nowadays, Neneng can process about 40-79 transactions per day. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Jumirati

texts.en:
Jumirati, her husband, and their only child live in Solo, a city in Central Java, also known as “Surakarta”. Jumirati’s husband works in a private company. Meanwhile, to support the family's living standards, Jumirati manages a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payments. She joined Ruma because she wanted to improve her shop by continuously learning from Ruma’s staff or agents. 

Nowadays, Jumirati’s shop is quite popular in the surrounding neighborhood; she can process 75-150 transactions per day. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Orita

texts.en:
Orita is a 40-year-old married woman with 5 children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Orita needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, a strainer, a large frying pan and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Orita became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, a strainer, a large frying pan and a new oven.

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda is a successful pig breeder. She has many sows and piglets which she fattens. She raise pigs at home - something she has done since she married.
But she has problem with waste generated in the form of pig manure. Inda has used the manure on the farm as organic fertilizer, but it was not enough. Hearing of the biogas program, she immediately joined; in addition to reducing costs in the kitchen, pollution of the environment can be overcome. She also hopes to become an example for the people in her village on the importance of using biogas for life.

With the loan, she will build a biogas reactor to maximize waste from pig manure. In addition, she will receive a better quality organic fertilizer then before that will be very useful for soil fertility in her garden. Inda will get 15,000,000 IDR to be used to build a biogas reactor. She hopes the plan will be successful so that she gets maximum results and will be able to reduce costs in the kitchen in addition to overcoming pollution of the environment.

loans.use: to build a biogas reactor.

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia. Ella en su cantón es reconocida como una mujer luchadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. María desea instalar agua potable en su vivienda ya que no cuenta con este vital liquido por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: derecho de instalación de agua potable y tubos, caños, grifos para la instalación de agua potable en su vivienda lo antes posible ya que es un servicio que todo hogar debe tener.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and lives in her own home. She is known in her area as a hardworking woman who earns a living lending her domestic services in people's homes. María wants to install drinking water in her home as she doesn't have this vital liquid. 

For this reason she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy the right to install drinking water, as well as tubes, pipes and faucets for the installation of drinking water in her home. She is hoping for this as soon as possible, as it is something that every home should have.

loans.use: to buy the right to install drinking water, as well as tubes, pipes and faucets for the installation of drinking water in her home.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime vive en concubinato y tiene 1 hijo Jaime vive en la comunidad de Achuta Grande en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad y tiene tanto luz como agua Jaime es albañil y agricultor, su trabajo hace que use materiales de construccion pesados Jaime desea comprar una mezcladora de cemento puesto que en Bolivia hay auge de la construccion y Jaime esta convencido de poder incrementar sus ingresos, la pareja de Jaime le ayuda cuidando ganado pero aún así, este hombre necesita ayuda
texts.en:
Jaime lives in a common-law marriage and has one son.  He lives in the community of Achuta Grande in an adobe house that he owns and has both light and water.  

Jaime is a bricklayer and farmer.  His job uses heavy construction materials.  Jaime wants to buy a cement mixer since there is a construction boom in Bolivia and he is convinced that he can increase his income.  Jaime's spouse helps take care of the animals but nevertheless, this man needs help.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and married.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, snack foods, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and paid back 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 35 years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Precelita

texts.en:
Precelita is 56 years old, widowed, and has six children, one of whom is still in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Precelita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2009, and plans to recover through her food vending business. With your help, Precelita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Inocencia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Inocencia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Inocencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal and firewood to sell to her customers in her charcoal and firewood business.

Julita has been in this business for 18 years. Julita earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal and firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn and her husband are both engineers by training. She has worked in hotel management, event planning and the tourism industry for several years. Together they decided to open a small, 24-room hotel in Jerusalem in 2010. Unfortunately Lynn’s husband became sick not long after they purchased the hotel. While her husband underwent treatment, Lynn developed the hotel and created a good business with real potential. Their original plan was for Lynn to develop the hotel while he worked and brought in a steady income until their profits would grow. Her husband won his battle, but one side effect was his loss of vision, which has prevented him from maintaining his job. They are working through the correct channels to receive compensation, but this will take time. In the meantime, Lynn had plans for renovations and upgrades to some of the rooms and general open areas. Now with the recent conflict, international tourism has come to a complete halt in Jerusalem.

Lynn needs this loan to assist with smaller renovations and prepare for the time when tourism returns to Jerusalem.

Lynn is a true professional. She wants to create a hotel that welcomes tourists and gives them an intimate glimpse at the diverse beauties of Jerusalem. Until then she is working to draw domestic tourists.

loans.use: To assist with smaller renovations and prepare for the time when tourism returns to Jerusalem.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Lorna has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a 36-year-old married woman from Tulkarm city. She is the mother of one small son. Fida is an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. She also works in a small grocery store with her husband. It is a good business and helps them to cover most of the family expenses.
Fida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new refrigerator for the grocery store. By taking this loan, Fida and her husband will be able to improve their business and increase the inventory. 

Fida appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for the grocery store.

loans.name: Tito Daniel

texts.es: Tito Daniel mayor de edad casado con cinco hijos todos menores de edad, originario de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, es un microempresario y administrador de sus propio negocio el cual consiste en un taller de ebanistería donde fabrican variedades estilos de muebles tanto rústicos como finos como: camas, roperos, cunas, puertas, gabeteros, juegos de sillas, multiusos entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza a contado en los aserrios donde le ofrecen calidad de madera y a buen precio, sus venta son al contado y al crédito tiene clientes fijos y eventuales entrega sus muebles a comerciantes del mercado de mayoreo de esta localidad y por encargos para uso de hogar los cuales recupera quincenal, inicia su negocio con capital propios productos de su trabajo anterior, el cual aprendió cuando era ayudante en una ebanistería, y es allí donde adquiere experiencia y con lo que ganaba iba comprando sus herramientas que ahora utiliza en su propio taller, su jornada diaria empieza muy temprano para lograr cubrir siempre los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder establecer mejor sus negocio teniendo su propia casa y así poder brindarles un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos verlos convertidos todos en unos profesionales algo que el no logro hacer debido a la pobreza en la que vivía con su familia, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de materia prima como:madera, tornillos, pegamento, cera, laca, lijas,picaportes, zener entre ortos mas, para lograr cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes al incrementar sus ventas mejoraran sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Tito Daniel is married and has five minor children.  He is from Chandega, which is located in the western part of the country.  The area is known for being commercially productive.  He is a small businessman, and he runs his own business.  He has a carpentry shop where he makes various styles of furniture.  He makes country style furniture as well as fine furniture.  He makes things like beds, wardrobes, cradles, file cabinets, sets of chairs, and modular furniture, among others.  He makes his purchases for cash at the saw mills where they sell quality wood for a good price.  He makes his sales for cash and on credit.  He has fixed and casual customers.  He delivers his furniture to merchants at the wholesale market in his area.  He also delivers orders for the home for which he collects every two weeks.

He started his business with his own capital that he got from his previous job.  He learned to do this when he was a helper at a carpentry shop.  That is where he got experience.  He used what he earned to buy his tools that he now uses in his own shop.  His daily work day starts very early in order to manage to always cover the orders that he has from his customers.

One of his dreams is to be able to better establish his business and having his own house.  This way he would be able to provide his children with a decent place to live.  He dreams of seeing his children become professionals.  This is something that he did not do because of the state of poverty in which his family lived.

He will use this loan to buy raw materials like wood, screws, glue, wax, sandpaper, door handles, and paint thinner, among others.  He will do this in order to complete various customer orders that he has.  As his sales increase, his income will improve.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 44 years old and has two children. Erlinda is married and has one child who is currently in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Erlinda is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 8,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Erlinda has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Erlinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 41 years old and has one child who is in school.

Margie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Margie has been with NWTF since 2009 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor. Rosita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. Leonila is married and has a business doing direct selling of personal collection products in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like detergent soap, body spray, body soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock like detergent soap, body spray, body soap and toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Maria Leda

texts.en:
Maria Leda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business, and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. She has been a member of NWTF since 2012.

With your help, Maria Leda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jonalie

texts.en:
Jonalie is 38 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her pig fattening business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can rebuild her family home.

Jonalie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 54-year-old married woman.  She has eight children, two of whom are currently in school.

Andresa is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She has been buying and selling livestock for 25 years now and has borrowed 15 times from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Andresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Annieliza

texts.en:
Annieliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen foods sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell for her business.

Annieliza has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready-to- wear.

Annieliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Vanntha

texts.en:
Vanntha is 57 years old, a rice and vegetable farmer, and a married woman with three children living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1985. Her husband is 62 and is also a farmer. Two of her children are garment factory workers and another is a student. Together, they can earn approximately $15 per day.

Now Vanntha would like to request a loan to buy a plow tractor for farming. This loan will help her work faster and earn more income. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland and save money for her youngest child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a plow tractor for farming

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en: Mrs. Davaakhuu, 54 years old, lives with her husband and son in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. She has been running a vocational training center since 2005, together with her husband. Their son is currently studying financial management at university. She is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to pay her son's tuition fee. Her son is a hard-working student who wants to succeed in life and make his mother happy.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl has been in this business for three years now.

Cheryl requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Cheryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza is 37 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor in order to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Ma. Riza can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her food vending business, and is now requesting a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. She has been in NWTF since 2012.

With your help, Manilyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Battsend

texts.en:
Battsend, 73, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He and his wife are retired and receive a state pension.
 
Until his retirement, he worked as a tractor driver at an agricultural entity for many years. His wife was an accountant and worked for a state farm. 

Using his previous loan, he has renovated the inside of his house, including insulating walls and repairing floors. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to install vacuum insulated windows. After installation, his house will no longer lose heat through its windows.  This will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thereby releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to install vacuum insulated windows in order to prevent heat loss.

loans.name: Santos Mardoqueo

texts.es: Santos de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar constituido por su madre dos tías y dos sobrinas.  Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como vendedor de pan dulce y pescador artesanal, desde hace 10 años lo que le ha permitido aportar económicamente al gasto del hogar. Santos desea construir un cuarto en la propiedad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además pagará mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto en su propiedad.
texts.en: Santos is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his family group which consists of his mother, two aunts and two nieces. He is a hard-working man who works selling sweet breads and fish. He has done this for 10 years and it allows him to support the household expenses. Santos wants to build a room on the property so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar as well as paying labor for the construction of the room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar and to pay for labor to build a room on his property.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah and all the members of the Kerta Jaya Amerta group succeeded in paying off all their loans on time. The repayment was presented by the head of the group because most of the members were attending a ceremony at the temple. Ni Nengah sold three of her piglets and she earned a satisfactory profit. She is very happy with this result, because now she can buy more piglets and renovate her house. She used the profits to buy paint to paint her house. Because the price of feed is expensive now, she hopes MUK can give her a larger loan for next period. One member resigned from the group after she had enough profit from her sales. Now she has capital to run her business by herself.

Because the price for feed is expensive, the Kerta Jaya Amerta group continues to borrow from MUK. They purchased piglets from their previous profits. Ni Nengah used her loan to purchase piglets and feed. From the last profits, she purchased two piglets and from the loan she purchased two more piglets. She will keep them for six months for fattening. She hopes this time she can sell the pigs for a high price. She will continue to renovate her house with the profits.

One member could not attend the meeting because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Lidia Ines

texts.es: La señora Lidia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la zona este de la cuidad, egresada de la carrera de enfermería, no tiene hijos que dependan de su ingreso, desde muy jovencita ella trabajaba y estudiaba porque su madre no tenía los medios suficientes como para ayudarle en sus estudios universitarios. La principal actividad  de la cliente es el servicio de enfermería, trabaja con una doctora muy buena que la acogió como su hija, con una experiencia  de 4 años en el rubro. Como no le alcanza su sueldo pese a que ella también trabaja de forma independiente,  inyectando, tomando presión, y en atención en general, solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora y para concluir sus trámites profesionales con el objetivo de obtener su título para desempeñar su profesión.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia is 22 years old, single, and lives in the area east of the city.  She is a graduate of nursing school, and has no children that rely on her income.  She has worked and studied since she was very young because her mother did not have sufficient means to help her with her university studies.

Lidia's main job is nursing.  She works with a very good doctor who welcomed her as a daughter and has four years of experience in the field. Since she does not meet her salary despite the fact that she also works independently by vaccinating, taking blood pressure, and in general care, she asks for a loan in order to buy a computer and to finish her professional paperwork with the goal of getting her title so that she can carry out her job.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers for her business.

Cecille has been in this business for five years. Cecille earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Cecille has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and has been in NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Loreta will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Loreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old and married with two children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like coffee, chocolate drink, toothpaste, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Marissa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like coffee, chocolate drink, toothpaste, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with three children. She is 65 years old and has one child who is still in school. Maria is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 
She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Maria requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a married woman with three children. She is 30 years old and two of her children are currently in school. Haydee is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has an upholstery business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 13 years.

Haydee requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like foam, nails, wood, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like foam, nails, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emelda works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.

Emelda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. Emelda hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Erdene, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an officer at a military division since 2010. His wife stays at home, looking after their youngest son. His elder son and daughter study at high school. His family lives in a rental apartment and there are not many home appliances. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a refrigerator in order to store meat and vegetables. Without a refrigerator, foodstuffs become uneatable and it costs him a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator in order to store foodstuffs

loans.name: Liysem

texts.en:
Liysem is 41 years old, a masseuse, and a widowed woman with four children living in Siem Reap Province. This is the province with lots of historic temples in Cambodia. Liysem has been a masseuse since 2012. All of her children are students and one of them is also a manicurist. Together, they can earn approximately $13 per day.

Now Liysem would like to request a loan to buy a motor for her child to go to school and to work. This loan will help her reduce traveling expenses and save more time. In the future, Liysem is going to open a café selling Chinese noodles, rice, and coffee; renovate her house; and, if possible, support all her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her child to go to school and to work

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en:
After one loan period, Kadek can repay her loan on time. During six months of keeping pigs, she enjoyed satisfactory results. From her pig sales, Kadek is using her profits for her children's education and for her family. The group hopes to continue their loans in the second period. They said thanks to you lenders, Kiva, and MUK for supporting their businesses.

Now Kadek has a new activity - in addition to farming in her garden, she has also busied herself with raising pigs. In this way, Kadek has a higher income than before she began raising pigs. The breeding process is going well without any obstacles. The advantage of raising pigs is she can use them for her family's everyday needs.

Having succeeded in the previous loan period, the Nyuh Gading group is proceeding to its next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 9,000,000 IDR for group lending and individuals each received 1,500,000 IDR. Because most have been able to increase the number of pigs they have, the current loan will be used to buy food and fix cages. Kadek will use her loan portion to buy superior feed and build new cages. She already has four sows. Kadek is very happy and she hopes to become a big pig seller in her village, using all the profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy superior feed and build new cages

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con la señora Margarita, viven en la zona sudoeste de la ciudad, ambos tienen un grado de instrucción de nivel primario, tienen 3 hijos dependientes de sus ingresos quienes aún asisten al colegio por las mañanas y por las tardes. La principal actividad  del señor es el servicio de operador de maquinaria en una empresa muy reconocida en la ciudad, con una antigüedad de 7 años en el rubro. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de helados ambulantes, la señora trabaja porque no alcanza el dinero que gana su esposo, actualmente él solicita un crédito para la refacción de su casa ya que se encuentra en precarias condiciones, así podra mejorar su calidad de vida a lado de sus hijos.
texts.en: Pablo is 39 years old and is married to Margarita. They live in the southwest area of the city and both completed their elementary school studies. They have three dependent children who attend school in the mornings and afternoons. The main occupation of this man is as a machinery operator in a well-known company in the city. He has been working there for 7 years. His wife sells ice-cream itinerantly as the money her husband makes is not enough for them. Pablo is requesting a loan to repair his house as it is in precarious condition. In doing this he can improve his quality of living along with his children's.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 56 years old and married with six children.

He earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Celso is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Celso has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from farming root crops.

He is working tirelessly towards the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosenda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling nipa roofing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Rosenda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, rice, spices, seasonings, meat, fish, etc. for her business.  Loreta has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, rice, spices, seasonings, meat, fish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 36 years old and married with five children. With five children currently in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nilda has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nilda has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Nilda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nora has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Nora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business doing direct selling of personal collection products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more products from personal collections to sell in her business. 

Cherilyn has been in this business for a year. Cherilyn earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.

Cherilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from personal products collections to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita works hard to support her family. Pablita is married and has a business selling herbal medicines in the Philippines.

Pablita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more herbal products to sell.

Pablita has been in this business for 14 years now.

Pablita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Visitacion is 57 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Visitacion has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Visitacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and items for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Visitacion has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Visitacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and items for her business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer muy determinante en sus sueños y que no solo hablo si no que actúa, hace 17 años inicio con un almacén de venta de ropa para mujer y gracias a este y sus buenas actitudes de vendedora ha tenido éxito. 

Es madre de dos hijas ya mayores de edad pero a una de ellas le ayuda económicamente con la matrícula de la universidad, aparte de eso está pagando su casa propia pues cansada de pagar arriendo decidió aventurarse a tener sus propias cosas. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía pues tiene muchos gastos y necesita vender bastante para soportar la carga de una matrícula universitaria más las cuotas de su casa propia, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de Blusas, Leguis, abrigos, jeans, etc. 

También cabe aclarar que Consuelo trabaja 9 horas diarias de lunes a domingo.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a woman with very specific dreams; she not only talks but acts. Seventeen years ago she opened a women’s clothing store. Thanks to her skills as a saleswoman she has been successful.

She has two daughters, both of them adults; however she still helps one financially with her university tuition fees. Apart from that, she is buying her own home since, tired of renting, she decided to venture into the world of ownership. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise because she has many expenses and needs to sell enough to underwrite the cost of university fees plus payments on her home. She will invest the loan to purchase blouses, leggings, coats, jeans, etc. 

It should be noted that Consuelo works 9 hours a day from Monday to Sunday.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing merchandise, which will help her cover her house payments and her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo vive en concubinato desde hace 5 años y tiene 3 hijos Marcelo vive en la comunidad de Kallutaka en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad y tiene agua y luz Marcelo es agricultor y chofer  y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción Marcelo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero es un hombre de buena salud, por lo que se recomienda ayudarle
texts.en: Marcelo has been in a common-law relationship for 5 years and has three children. Marcelo lives in the community of Kallutaka in an abode house which he owns. It has water and electricity. Marcelo is a farmer and a driver . He needs a loan to buy a milk cow to increase his production. Marcelo is the only source of income in his house but he is in good health so you should help him.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase his production.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene de 40 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 12 años se gana la vida elaborando pan dulce y quesadillas de arroz en un horno artesanal. Marlene desea construir un baño con pila para tener donde recoger agua. Por lo anterior Marlene solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un baño con pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marlene, 40, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her 13-year-old daughter. She is a tenacious woman who has been earning a living making sweet bread and rice quesadillas in an artisanal oven for 12 years. 

Marlene wants to build a washroom with a sink where she can get water. For the above, Marlene is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron. In addition, she has to pay for manual labour.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron as well as pay for manual labour to build a bathroom with a sink.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is separated and has a business selling personal collection products in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers.

Elsa has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 49 years old and married with two children. Mila works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, cooking oil, diapers, and sanitary pads.

Mila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 51 years old and married with two children.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Clarita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Clarita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado de nivel académico, es soltero vive con el papá y la mamá.

 Héctor es agricultor desde hace 30 años a este trabajo le enseño el papá, ya que quería que su hijo aprendiera un oficio y fue así que siempre lo andaba cuando trabajaba, su horario de trabajo es de las 6:00 am a las 11:00 pm.

El préstamo solicitado lo ocupara para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas.  El crédito anterior lo ocupo para comprar los mismos productos,  para la milpa de invierno, pero por la falta de lluvias se le perdió. Hoy en día quiere aprovechar los cultivos de la milpa de verano,  ya que por las muchas pérdidas que ha habido el maíz se ha puesto caro y hoy ellos cultivaran mucho para vender y sacar las ganancias.

Los sueños de Héctor  es que siempre tengan la oportunidad de seguir trabajando y ayudarles a los padres a que no les falten los alimentos en casa para que los padres gocen en su vejez.
texts.en:
Héctor, 46, studied up to eighth grade in school.  He's single and lives with his father and mother.

Héctor has been a farmer for 30 years.  His father taught him this job because he wanted his son to learn a trade and he always went to work with him.  His work schedule is from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m.

The requested loan is to buy corn seed, soil amendments, pesticide, and herbicide.

He used the previous loan to buy the same products for his winter cornfield, which he lost because of a lack of rain.  Now he wants to make the most of the crops in his summer cornfield.  Corn has become expensive because of all the losses, and now they'll grow a lot to sell and earn the profits.

Héctor's dreams are to always have the opportunity to keep on working and to help his parents so they don't lack food at home and they can enjoy their old age.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, soil amendments, pesticide, and herbicide

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 54, married, and has four children living in Lahore. She is a housewife. Her husband has a painting business where he provides white wash services for his customers. He buys the required material from the local market and uses it for white wash purposes. He is the sole bread-winner in the family and he works very hard to make ends meet. 

Therefore, Rani's husband wants to expand his painting business to earn more income and improve their standard of living. To help her husband, Rani has requested a loan to help her husband increase and enhance his painting business.

loans.use: to expand in her husband's painting (white wash) business

loans.name: Grupo Sector Los Par Group

texts.es:
De 37 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene ocho hijos los primeros tres hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los cinco son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, (Bartola es la que se encuentra en medio del grupo)
	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra venta y tejedora de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Bartola para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de hilos para poder realizar su trabajo de tejer los trajes típicos par luego a su respectiva venta por los  alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
This member is 37 years old, with great aspirations to have her community known and to all who visits, the activity she does with much effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband with the desire to overcome in life and achieve great dreams. She has eight children, the first three already have their own families and the other five are excellent students in the community school, (Bartola is the one in the middle of the group).   

The work she does so carefully is buying, selling and weaving of traditional suits, this activity is done at home and in nearby places in her community where she lives. The second activity she performs is selling light refreshments that she has been doing with her sister for more than five years as they generate a profit for the wellbeing of their families and improve the economic conditions of their families and communities.
She has been an example in her community and it’s for this reason that a group of women have joined Bartola to be able to start their businesses so each one can overcome and have good income.

She will use the loan to buy thread to make her traditional clothing so she can sell them in the surrounding areas. One of her dreams is to have a stall in the community market and see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase thread to make traditionally clothing.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 29, married, and a mother of two, living in Lahore. She is a caring and supportive housewife. Her husband runs a men's salon in the market near their house. He is a soft-spoken and hardworking person. He provides services like hair cuts, facials, massages, shaves, etc. His customers are content with his services.

Due to constant usage, his salon furniture is depreciating and now he wants to replace it with new furniture. Also, new furniture would create better ambiance in his salon and more customers will be attracted to it. But, this is not possible with his current income. Therefore, his wife has applied for a micro-finance loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy furniture items for her husband's salon

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia vive en concubinato desde hace 8 años y tiene 3 hijos Ella vive en la comunidad de Alto Japuraya en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad y tiene luz y agua Delia elabora y vende quesos y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera para incrementar su produccion de queso La pareja de Delia trabaja como albañil pero lo que gana no es suficiente por eso Delia necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Delia has lived with a partner for 8 years and has three children.  She lives in the community of Alto Japurava in an adobe house that belongs to her and has electricity and water service.  Delia makes and sells cheese and needs a loan to buy a milk cow to increase her cheese production.  Delia's partner has worked as a mason but doesn't earn enough, that is why Delia needs the help.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
Mamlakat was born in 1958 in a rural area. She is married and has three children. Her children are adults. Mamlakat lives in a rural area where many people are engaged in animal husbandry and farming. Mamlakat began her business in animal husbandry 25 years ago. She feeds cows and sells them at a local market. Mamlakat’s sons help her manage the business. She is busy with this business during the whole year. She tries to improve the family's living conditions. 

Mamlakat is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy cattle to increase working capital. From the profit, she will send her grandchildren to school. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase work tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 42 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Marilyn has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years. Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан 47 лет, вдова, многодетная мать 5 детей, трое младших - школьники и студенты. Бурулкан с 1990 года занимается разведением скота, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 2 лошади и 8 овец. Средства от перепродажи скота и пособия для детей - единственный источник пропитания и дохода для семьи Бурулкан. На сегодняшний день ее прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет в среднем 2,500 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. А ведь еще нужно расширять свой бизнес. В связи с приближающимся зимним периодом, Бурулкан хочет закупить корм для скота, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS). Это позволит Бурулкан сохранить и приумножить поголовье скота. В будущем, Бурулкан мечтает дать хорошее образование своим детям и помочь сыну в строительстве собственного дома.
texts.en: Burulkan is 47, widowed, and the mother of five children. The three youngest are in school. She has been raising livestock since 1990 and currently has two cows, one calf, two horses, and eight sheep. Her only income comes from cattle sales and financial assistance for her children. She currently earns 2,500 som (KGS) per month, which is not enough to support a family and live a decent life. She needs to expand her business. Because the winter season is approaching, Burulkan wants to buy feed for the livestock and applied for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank. This will allow her to take care of the livestock and increase their numbers. In the future, Burulkan dreams of giving her children a good education and of helping her son to build his own home.

loans.use: To purchase hay and feed for cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 31 years old, married, and living in Rawalpindi. She has two daughters and a son. She is a housewife and looks after her children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. He also provides pick up and drop services. He is a hardworking person. He is the only earning person in the family. As he has to drive his taxi day and night, some of its components have depreciated and need to be repaired. But he lacks the amount to pay for the maintenance expenses because he is unable to save due to their increasing expenses. Rukhsana has therefore requested a loan to help her husband repair his taxi. Their dream is to educate their children and give them a better life.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Norma has been in this business for six years. Norma earns additional  income from pig fattening.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Veronica, 40 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Koibarak, a remote village in Kapsowar. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Veronica is happily married and blessed with 4 children. For the past 3 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. 

She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Kapsowar area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. 

Veronica is a member of Kaptabuk and through the group they have received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina belongs to Rawalpindi. She is 30 years old and a stay-at-home mother of four children. They live in a rented house. Her husband runs an auto workshop in the nearby market. He is hardworking, and most of his time is spent repairing auto parts in his workshop. He is the sole earner in the family. 

Samina looks after her house and children and makes sure that they spend within their budget, as they have a big family and fulfilling all their needs with the current income is difficult. In order to become more profitable, her husband wants to enhance and extend his business. For this reason his wife has requested a loan to help her husband. They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To enhance her husband's auto workshop.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is 27 years old and a married man living with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. Majed studied the Elementary education. Due to the miserable condition of his family, he couldn't complete his studies. 

His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man. As the main source of income for his family, Majed has sold groceries and food products in a small grocery since 2012. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to Majed's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed Majed to expand his sales volume. 

For the purpose of further developing his business, Majed turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 YER to buy more food items for future retail in his grocery in order to meet all the demands of his customers.

Majed plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business more through opening another grocery store to provide his family with a better future. He plans to open a savings account at AMB.

loans.use: to buy more food items for future retail in his grocery.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra belongs to Rawalpindi. She is 40 years old and a dedicated mother of two children. She is always supportive of her family. Her husband is a taxi driver. He has been driving taxi for 10 years now. The main source of income comes from driving the taxi. As they depend on this single income, it is very difficult for them to meet their daily expenses.  

Due to regular driving, the taxi needs to be repaired so that it drives smoothly. As the entire family depends on this single source of income, its proper maintenance is very necessary. Their current income is not sufficient enough to help them pay for the maintenance charges of the taxi. Therefore Azra has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for helping her with the loan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single young man from Beddya, a village near Nablus city. He lives alone in a small house. One year ago, Ahmad started his own Beekeeping business. He sells honey in the local market. It is a very good business but needs a lot of care. 

Ahmad requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more beehives for his business. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. Ahmad appears in the photo taken while he was taking care of the beehives.

loans.use: to buy more beehives for his business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Alice, a very dedicated mother who believes in hard work. She is happily married and blessed with 4 lovely children whom she often refers to as “my pride”. She is based in Kapsowar, a small remote rural town in Kenya. For the past 2 years she has actively been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk and crop farming. 

Alice passionately loves dairy farming, and this can be attested to by the fact that she has nicknamed one of her cows “Chebirir”. Milking Chebirir (the name of her cow) is her hobby, and feeding her cow makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Alice. Although this humble mum makes a living through selling milk, she faces the challenge of meeting the demand that is in her area. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a quality breed of cow. The loan will enable her to buy not just an ordinary cow but an exotic breed that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. With this cow she will be assured of increased income and an increase in profit margins. Being from a marginalized community women face many challenges, but Alice believes that through Kiva lenders her dream of being financially stable will be achieved. 

Selling milk will provide a regular income for Alice and hence meet the daily expenses of her family. Alice's dream is to increase her milk selling enterprise and help secure the future of her children through giving them a proper education. Education is the only way that her children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Rozan

texts.en:
Rozan is a 35-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is a mother of five kids, three sons and two daughters. All of them are attending schools. Her husband is a worker where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family 's needs. 

Rozan and her husband also have agricultural land where they plant olive trees. They produce olive oil and sell it in the local market. It is a very good business and supports them with part of their expenses. 

Rozan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm. By taking this loan, Rozan and her husband will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity.  Rozan appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 46 years old and married with three children.

Pablita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pablita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Pablita aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Zarik

texts.en:
Zarik lives in Yerevan with her husband and daughter. For three years, this family has been running a small food market in Yerevan town. They work hard to satisfy their customers' demands and stay competitive and profitable in the market. 

Zarik has requested this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase a refrigerator, fruits and vegetables, and household goods for reselling. She hopes for lenders' support as the refrigerator that they have now is not working, which makes a number of difficulties for Zarik in operating the market and keeping the supplies fresh.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator, fruits and vegetables, and household goods for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for farm implements and construction of a cowshed.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, Mwaka has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With this loan that she is requesting, Mwaka wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials for her mat weaving business.

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad,  no fue a la escuela, una por falta de escuela en la zona y lo otro por el poco interés que le daban los padres de antes al aprendizaje,  se casó a la edad de los dieciocho años, procrearon 5 hijos con su pareja. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, los cinco hijos viven en su casa, tres de ellos estudian y los demás trabajan en casa, nadie aparte del núcleo vive con ella.
 

María aparte de ser ama de casa también apoya a su hijo y esposo en la agricultura, trabajan un vivero de tilapias las que cuida y luego las vende, del negocio de las tilapias, tiene dos años de haber empezado en capacitaciones que realizaban en la comunidad acerca de los criaderos de peces fue donde le inicio la idea de poner su propio vivero. Aparte del negocio que generaba de la venta de la cosecha no tenía más actividades. El vivero lo tienen a unos 100 metros de la casa.

El préstamo anterior se tramito con la línea kiva, el resultado de la inversión fue fallido ya que se produjo una sequía en la zona y los cultivos no dieron resultado, por lo que hoy lo intentara de nuevo para ver si sacan los granos básicos que son el pan de cada día en la comida.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, pesticidas,  herbicidas y pago de mano de obra. El mejoramiento será el tener capital de trabajo para intentar de nuevo  poder cosechar lo necesario, la necesidad satisfecha será el seguir luchando para producir lo que se consume.

Desea lograr  mantener su familia siempre unida es lo más importante, luego luchar siempre cada día contra todas las adversidades, lo que espera a futuro es por heredarles un buen ejemplo de responsabilidad a sus hijos, el préstamo le ayudara en solventar la necesidad antes mencionada, de la ganancia de la inversión espera pagar la cuota y mantener su hogar.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and did not attend school as there was no school in her area and her parents had little interest in schooling. She married at 18 and had five children with her spouse. Her husband is a farmer and the five children live in her house. Three of them study and the other two work there. No one else lives with them.

Besides being a housewife María supports her son and husband with the farming. She works in a fish pond where she raises and sells tilapia. She started the tilapia business two years ago after having participating in training about raising fish that took place in her community. From this she got her idea of starting her own fish pond. Other than the business that is created by the sales she has no other activities. The pond is about 100 meters from her house.

The investment from the previous loan that she got through Kiva was not successful as there was a drought in the zone and the crops didn't produce. So now they will try once again attempt to grow the basic grains which are the basis of their day to day food.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy corn seed, pesticides, herbicides and pay for labor. The improvement will be to have the working capital to to try again to produce what they need. Once they have what they need then they can continue to struggle to produce what they consume.

María wants to keep her family together, that is the most important thing. Next is the struggle against their setbacks which she hopes will be a good example of being responsible for her children in the future. The loan will help her with the aforementioned needs and she hopes that the profits from the investment will pay off the loan and support her household.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, pesticides, herbicides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a housewife and lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She is 55 years old and is a mother of 3. She has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair his taxi. He is a taxi driver by profession and has been driving taxi for the last five years. He works day and night to make sure that their daily needs are met. 

As the income they get from driving the taxi only covers their daily expenses, they are unable to save money. After receiving this loan her husband will be able to repair his taxi. Yasmeen and her husband want their children to excel in their lives and have a better future.

loans.use: To help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Yadamsuren

texts.en: Yadamsuren, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. Their daughter and son are 4 and 2 years old, respectively. Currently, they are living in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). Having his own house is his long-time dream, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a plot of land and an old house. After renovating this house, his family will live in a comfortable place.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and an old house in order to reach his long-time dream.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 19-year-old single young lady from Al Yamoun, a village near Jenin city. She lives with her family in a very simple house. Her father works as a construction worker where he earns a low and unstable income. Israa is a college student. She studies nursing. She would like to complete her study and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Israa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the college installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Israa will be able to earn the BA degree and find a job faster.

Israa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the college installments for this semester.

loans.name: Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Florence is a father of four children, two are at school while the rest are still young. He is in his early forties and married. Since 2000, he has been managing his family by running a butcher shop. He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his eighth loan cycle. With his previous loan cycles, since repaid, he improved his shop with more meat. His customers now are happier because they can have more as they want. Florence still desires to sell more to catch up with his market. He managed to earn an extra income which he used to build a house, paid school fees and household expenses. He dreams of building a nice family house. With his new loan request, Florence will increase meat stock from 100 kg to 200 kg.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tujikwamue" which consists of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase meat stock from 100 kg to 200 kg.

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.en:
Modesta is a business mother of four children who are at school. She is in her early forties and runs an agricultural livestock business, raising chickens and goats. She has been in this business for three years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her first loan request via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She will share this loan with Paris, a five member group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Modesta will use her portion to buy livestock. She desires to improve her business as well as her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a business direct selling Natasha products in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Natasha products to sell to her customers.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 15 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Natasha products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Alaverdi town with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 5 years old). 

Gohar rents a small space in the business center of Alaverdi town where she provides different computer services.
