Her husband wishes to extend his paint work business to earn more income and improve their standard of living. To help her husband in the business Rani has requested for a loan from BRAC Pakistan - a KIVA partner.

loans.use: to increase in her husband's paint work (white wash)

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic owns and operates an agricultural farm growing coconut, banana and other crops for a living. Marivic has been engaged in farming for many years and she earns well from these activities. Her farm is doing well with the effort of her husband and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy fertilizer and pay weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 36-year-old married father of three children ages 10, 6 and 4. He deals in banana selling and also earns from rentals and a motorcycle transport businesses. He faces a problem of limited capital but hopes to build a good residential house. He needs a loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en: Raksmey is a 28-year-old single man. He has been a construction foreman since 2006. He lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He can earn approximately $10 per day. Now Raksmey would like to request a loan to buy construction tools such as handle rosewood planes; spades; scaffolding; wheelbarrows, etc. to use in his work. This loan will help him work faster. In the future, he is going to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy construction tools such as handle rosewood planes; spades; scaffolding; wheelbarrows

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon is 34 years old, a homemaker and a married woman with two small children. Her husband is 41, a bulldozer driver earning $12 per day and he has been a bulldozer since 2000. They live in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. 

Now Chhon would like to request a loan to build a bathroom. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to open a shop for her children designing clothes and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 45, a resident of Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines. She’s married to Mario, a worker abroad, and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelyn is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Evelyn and her family also own and operate a ricemill business but their farm machinery is having sort of technical problem at this moment. Evelyn is shown in the photo with their rice field. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. She used to buy stocks from other suppliers whenever they are having problem with their ricemill.

Evelyn hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams of giving her children a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more sacks of rice needed in her retailing business.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth una joven muy pujante y emprendedora que diariamente trabaja con una intensidad horaria de 10 horas en la venta de mercancía de uso personal, como lo es crema de manos, productos capilares, productos de maquillaje, lociones, entre otros.  La profesión lo hace ambulantemente y al desplazarse en bus o a pie sus sectores son muy restringidos pues no llega a muchos barrios por cansancio físico o por que el tiempo en le transporte es muy largo.

Consciente de esta situación Lizeth acude a la corporación con le animo de solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar un motocicleta para desplazarse y poder llevar sus productos a diferentes barrios. 

Por favor colaboren con este crédito ella es una madre joven con un hijo a cargo de 2 años la moto le permitirá verlo más seguido que para ambos es muy importante y le generara mejores ingresos para apoyar a su familia, tiene proyectos de mejorar su casa (ver foto) y salir adelante y enfrentar el futuro.
texts.en:
Lizeth is a strong and enterprising young woman who works an intense 10 hour schedule daily, selling personal use merchandise like hand creams, hair styling products, make up products and lotions, among others. She is a traveling salesperson and traveling by bus or on foot prevents her from going to many neighborhood because she is physically exhausted or the transport takes too long. Understanding the situation, Lizeth came to the corporation with the goal of requesting a loan that would allow her to buy a motorcycle for travel, allowing her to bring her products to different neighborhoods. 

Please help her with this loan. She is a young mother with a two year old child and the motorcycle will allow her to see him more often and it is important for both of them that she generate more income for her family. She has plans to improve her home (see photo), getting ahead and confronting the future.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to travel along the sidewalks selling her products, helping her to have more time for her two year old child.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is  taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as oil, fish, milk and slippers. She opened her kiosk in 2013  with her own working capital of $1000.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, fish, milk, and slippers

loans.name: Teresa Gueily

texts.es:
Teresa es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud.
Ella es emprendedora, soñadora, amigable, alegre, conversadora, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Miraflores un lugar caracterizado por el Estadio Hernando Siles; donde todos los clubes de fútbol paceño juegan de local para la Liga de Fútbol Profesional Boliviano y acoge también todos los partidos de la selección de fútbol de Bolivia. Con una capacidad de 46mil espectadores, el estadio se encuentra situado a 3700 sobre el nivel del mar.
Teresa es de tez morena, cabello largo castaño, estatura media, su lengua materna es el español. Su trabajo es el comercio de productos naturales para la salud como; Ansiedad, antienvejecimiento,  artritis, perder peso, colesterol, colon irritable, depresión, dermatitis, digestión, estrés, gastritis, etc.
Ella sueña con ser una marca conocida a nivel nacional y ayudar a sus clientes a mejorar su salud introduciéndose al mercado y difundiendo sus productos. Ella debe realizar la compra de mercadería por mayor para reducir a su competencia directa y generar mejores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos naturales por mayor para introducir al mercado.
texts.en:
21-year old Teresa is single and has no children. To earn her living she sells natural health products. She is enterprising, forward-looking, friendly, lively, chatty, independent, responsible, and very hardworking. 

Teresa's business is located in the Miraflores area, in the vicinity of the well-known Hernando Siles Stadium where all the La Paz football clubs play in the Bolivian Professional Football League. All the main Bolivian football matches take place there too. The stadium has a capacity of 46,000 spectators and is located 3,700m above sea level.

Teresa has a dark complexion, long brown hair, and is of average height. Her native language is Spanish. She sells natural health products to prevent anxiety, aging, arthritis, high cholesterol, irritable bowel syndrome, depression, dermatitis, stress, gastritis, and to help with weight loss and digestion.

Her dream is to have her brand recognized at the national level and to help her clients improve their health by introducing them to a variety of products. She needs to buy merchandise in bulk so she can compete in the marketplace and generate more income.

For these reasons Teresa is seeking a loan to buy natural products in bulk to introduce to her customers.

loans.use: Buy natural health products in bulk

loans.name: Marwin Yiced

texts.es:
Marwin una mujer con un hermoso corazón que nunca se dejó quebrantar por los problemas familiares pues es muy duro separarse de la pareja con quien tuvo dos hijos, pero sabe que tiene que estar firme por ellos. 

Es madre de dos hijos de 5 y 20 años de edad y muy orgullosa pues no quiere que su esposo le ayude pues le demostrara que tiene todas las capacidades y pantalones para ejercer el papel de padre y madre y para ello necesita una entrada de dinero para seguir con la normalidad cotidiana que estaba acostumbrada. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar el negocio de venta de cosméticos, actividad que aprendió pro su madre quien toda la vida la enseño a valerse por ella misma. 

Con el crédito comprara dos vitrinas y productos como lociones, crema de manos, productos capilares, productos de belleza, bolsos, billeteras y accesorios como retes, pulseras, colarles, reloj. 

El crédito será de gran utilidad para ella pues iniciara la empresa que les dará de comer a ella y  su dos hijos, pagar las cuentas de servicio, arrendamiento etc.
texts.en:
Marwin is a woman with a beautiful heart who never let family problems break her spirit. It was very difficult for her to separate from her husband, with whom she has two children, but she knows that she has to be strong for them.

She is the mother of two children, ages 5 and 20, and is very proud of them but doesn't want any help from their father because she is capable and has the courage to play the role of father and mother. She needs money to continue with the daily life to which she is accustomed.

She requests a loan to start a cosmetic sales business, a business that she learned from her mother who taught her to value herself.

She will use the loan to purchase two display cases and products like lotions, hand cream, hair products, beauty products, purses, wallets, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and watches. 

The loan will be very useful because she will start the business that will give her and her children food and pay for their utilities, rent, etc.

loans.use: to start her cosmetic sales business and purchase display cases, lotions, hair products, beauty products, purses, wallets, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and watches.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie works hard to support his family. He is married and has had a dried fish vending business for 8 years. 

He requested 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

In the future, Jessie would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and laundry soap

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her spouse works as fireman while she operates a retail store selling grocery items to the people in their village. She wanted to increase her income and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, breads, sugar, coffee and soft drinks to sell. This will help improve her sales and income as well. She will save additional revenue for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, sugar, coffee and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ilcia Areli

texts.es: Ilcia de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad y una hija mayor de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con la venta de pupusas en su comunidad actividad que le ha permitido apoyar con los gastos del hogar a su compañero de vida. Ilcia desea encementar el corredor de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
41-year old Ilicia lives in her own house with her husband and 12-year old daughter, plus a second adult daughter. She is an enterprising woman who earns her living selling stuffed tortillas in the community. The income she brings in helps her husband with household costs.

Ilicia wishes to cement the floor of the passageway in her home so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of the passageway in her home

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en:
In 2009, Jhonny learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance that it provides. He tried his luck in operating a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money that he used as capital. 

Jhonny has borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help to give his farming income a big boost. Jhonny looks forward to better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a direct-selling business of Natasha products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 48 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business making nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo, wire, etc.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo, wire, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eye shadow, creams, eye pencils, nail polish remover, sandals, bracelets, rings, plastic toys, balls, etc, for his business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad. Él es un hombre visionario que se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado la cual realiza en su cantón desde hace 31 años, además su compañera de vida aporta a la economía familiar elaborando prendas de vestir por encargo. Francisco desea realizar algunas mejoras a su corredor ya que actualmente esta deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo de piso y pagar mano de obra para realizar mejoras al corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
51-year old Francisco lives in his own home with his wife and two children aged 11 and 13. He is a forward-looking man who earns his living buying and selling cattle, a job je's been doing in his neighbourhood for 31 years. His wife also helps with household expenses through her work making clothing from orders. 

Francisco wishes to improve the passageway in his house so he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, floor tiles, and to pay for installation.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravel, floor tiles, and to pay for installation of repairs to the passage in his house

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is single and has an Internet café business in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to pay electric and Internet bills.

Luisa has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay electric and Internet bills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the cocoa plantations.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a catering service business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, vegetables, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for one year now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Yanet Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanet inicio la venta de mercancías variadas como ropa y algunos accesorios para el hogar hace años atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga quien le enseño acerca del negocio y desde ahí emprendió esta actividad como un alternativa de generar dinero y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. 

Es mujer pujante, verraca pero ante todo dedicada.

Siempre intenta encontrar el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos y su esposo, debido al alza de los precios de la canasta familiar, del arriendo, gastos escolares, Yanet se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos.

Es por este motivo que necesita un crédito que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que vende y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta, solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de moda y artículos para uso domestico y así añadirlos a su portafolio de productos.
 
Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén y manejar sus propios ingresos, generando empleo y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yanet started selling various merchandise like clothes and household accessories several years ago. She learned the work thanks to a friend who taught her about the business and from there she started this work as an alternative to generate income and help her husband with household expenses. She is a hard-working, strong woman and before everything, dedicated.

She always tries to find support for her home which is comprised of her two children and her husband. Due to the increase in prices for groceries, rent, and school, Yanet sees the necessity of earning more money. It is for this motivation that she needs a loan to help her improve the variety of products that she sells and that she offers daily to her clients and people door to door. She requests a loan to buy fashionable clothes and household articles and add them to her inventory of products.

Her main dream is to become the own of a store and manager her own income, create employment, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fashionable clothes and household articles and so improve her traveling sales to support her home.

loans.name: Nanang

texts.en:
Nanang runs a small stall, which sells phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Cianjur, a rural area about four hours from Jakarta. Nanang is married and living with his three children (two sons and a daughter) and his lovely wife in the family home. His wife is a housewife.

Nanang first joined Ruma because he wants to explore his business by recruiting more agents below him. He feels really excited to expand his only business, selling mobile phone airtime credits as his only and major source of income for the family. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions.

loans.use: to process more airtime transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri lives in Solo, Central Java, around two hours from Yogyakarta. Solo is known as a small cultural town beside Yogyakarta, which was also reigned over by royalty. Tri manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credit. She just got married and is living with her husband.

Tri joined Ruma because she believes Ruma could help her improve her business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Tri hopes to see improvements in her shop. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to add more products and to provide more effective service.

loans.use: to process more airtime transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Саноату 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Саноат занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает корову и продает молоко и молочные продукты местным жителям. Она данное время откармливает 2 коров и ей очень хотелось бы увеличить оборотный капитал. Саноат с бизнесом справляется сама, так как ее муж строитель и не имеет время для того, чтобы помочь ей введению бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Since her childhood, Sanoat has been helping out her parents to raise livestock. She is a very hard-working person. Sanoat is 34 years old. She is married and has three underage children. Sanoat raises livestock. She fattens cows and sells milk and dairy products in the region. At present she is fattening two cows, and she would really like to increase her working capital. Sanoat manages her business by herself, since her husband is a construction worker and has no time to help her in the business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 TJS to buy cattle and [eventually ]increase her working capital. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in view of increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
This is Elma, 46, and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Gerardo, her business partner, and she is a mother to their children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. At the present time, she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her family.

Elma operates an auto repair shop. They offer repairs, check-ups, beautification, painting and tinting of all types of cars, jeepneys, and any type of vehicle that is referred to them. Her husband is the main repairman while she sews the car interior, cover and other car upholstery.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy supplies like car interiors and upholstery, putty paint, tint and other materials needed in her repair shop.

Elma hopes to improve her service and attract more clients. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en: Mariel, 43 years old, is married with seven children. She has been involved in raising hogs for five years. Mariel is a very responsible mother. She likes to do her best just to sustain the daily needs of her family. Her husband is managing their small farm. To have additional income, Mariel is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her business. She hopes someday she can see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 29 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom in school. To earn an income she has been fattening pigs to sell for five years now.

Roselyn has borrowed and successfully repaid six prior loans through NWTF to support her pig business. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Roselyn’s goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children, four of which are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nieves has a welding shop in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her business.

Nieves has been in the welding business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Emily has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Anie

texts.en:
Ma. Anie is 26 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. 

Ma. Anie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Anie requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Anie has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Anie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell veterinary products business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell for her veterinary products business.

Marilou has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from farming rice. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Cristina has been in this business for 23 years. 

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.


In the future Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise pigs and buy more beans to make tofu

loans.name: Gogoni Group

texts.en:
Ester is in her mid-30s. She is single and has no children. She has been running a genge (grocery) business since 2010. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Ester's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of buying a plot of land.

Ester will share this loan with her loan group, Gogoni, which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 47, married to a government employee, and blessed with three children. She owns and manages a food vending business in their village and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase raw meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, and food seasonings to cook. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, and food seasonings to cook food for sale.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Rey, 45, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of three dependent children who are enrolling in a local school. By operating a farming business on a small plantation, Rey can earn around 3 USD a day to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for 20 years.

To keep her plants growing well with more fruit, Rey is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process in this farming season. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her plants grow better and provide more benefit to her. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Helen is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Maria Vec

texts.en:
Maria Vec works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year now.

Maria Vec requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock such as hot-dog, bacon, fish balls, ham, etc to sell. 

In the future, Maria Vec would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as hot-dog, bacon, fish balls, ham, etc to sell.

loans.name: Murni

texts.en:
Murni is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a fisherman. He works to find the fish and sell it.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation will make her and her family’s health better. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home.

loans.name: Sri Yanti

texts.en:
Sri Yanti is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has four daughters. Her husband is a fisherman. He works to find the fish and sell it.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation will make her and her family’s health better. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for their family by building a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 36 años de edad habita junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 7 años de edad, en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre que ha demostrado su tenacidad para el trabajo, ya que desde hace 11 años se gana la vida como albañil independiente, actividad que le permite sostener la economía familiar. Salvador adquirió un crédito anteriormente con FUSAI con el cual construyo las paredes de su vivienda, ahora solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: un portón de hierro y pagar mano de obra para colocarlo frente a su vivienda y proteger así sus pertenencias y a su familia.
texts.en: Salvador, 36, lives with his wife and three children, ages 13, 10 and 7, in his own home.  He is a person who has shown tenacity in his work since he has been earning a living as an independent bricklayer and supporting the household for 11 years.  Salvador received a previous loan through FUSAI which he used to build the walls of his house.  Now he is requesting a new FUSAI loan to buy an iron gate and pay labor costs to have it installed in his home to protect his family and their belongings.

loans.use: To buy an iron gate and pay labor costs to install it.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, leche, huevos, etc. Además aprovechando la clientela vende productos por catalogo. Reina adquirió un crédito anteriormente con el cual construyo una pila, actualmente desea colocar ladrillo de piso al corredor de su vivienda ya que este es de cemento pero se encuentra agrietado por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para colocar ladrillo de piso en el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reina, 31, lives in her own home with her common-law husband and their two children, ages 7 and 9.  She is an enterprising woman who three years ago began selling basic goods such as rice, beans, milk, eggs, etc. from home.  She also sells products by catalogue to her customers.  

Reina received a previous loan which she used to build a sink.  Now she wants to lay tile in the cement hallway which has cracks.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy floor tile, cement, sand and gravel for the hallway in her home.

loans.use: To buy floor tile, cement, sand and gravel for the hallway in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables for the beverages and gas to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock from the countryside to provide healthy and affordable meat to local customers.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe has been operating a transportation services business for many years while her husband is working. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor maintenance costs. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC micro-finance services. With her income, she had put up a retail business selling vehicle parts and accessories. She took a new loan recently to buy additional spare parts and accessories for sale.  Fe wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and accessories for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailor shop

loans.name: Virgencita

texts.en: Virgencita  is 52 and has three children. To make a living, she owns a farm located in their community of Gango, Ozamiz City, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. For seven years in farming, she earns income that is enough for their daily expenditures. With her income, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She find ways to earn more income for the family and she begin selling woven nipa in their village. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase raw materials like palm leaves and bamboo to improve her manufacturing business. Having more returns from her activities is all Vergencita wants for she planned to purchase additional farm lot.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like palm leaves and bamboo

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso is 43 years old, married to Maria Fe and they have three children. As a way of generating income, he is engaged in a variety store business within his community in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family. He also has a computer shop for additional income.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Tirso wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. With this, he would like to avail a loan amounting to 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Tirso hopes that his business will continue to expand and dreams to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.		

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his business.

loans.name: Merelin

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Merelin works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Merelin is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Merelin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette used her  previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She is still in the same business of selling clothes in order to raise enough income. She faces the challenge of competition. Besides that, she hopes to get married and expand her business to new areas. Rosette needs a loan to buy building materials for her house construction project.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house construction project.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius used the previous loan to buy more chicks for his poultry farm. He is still in the same business of rearing poultry alongside selling bananas and piggery plus selling roasted chicken. He faces challenges of competition and inadequate capital. However, he hopes to have a permanent location for his roasting business since he operates in an open place on the street. Julius needs a loan to  buy more chicks for his poultry farm and slaughtering.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for his poultry farm and slaughtering.

loans.name: Noman Adil Sultan

texts.en: Noman is 36 years old and living in Hyderabad with his family. He has two children. He has a garments business and has been selling a different variety of gentlemen's garments like shirts, trousers, pants, suits, etc. for the past five years. He is good at doing business. He keeps track of new trends and purchases stock accordingly from the local market at wholesale prices. His business is doing well and he feels that there is still a lot of room for profiting. Therefore he has decided to buy a different variety of garments. He has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help him purchase additional garments such as suits for his shop with the hope of increasing sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional garments to increase sales.

loans.name: Muhammad Bilal

texts.en:
M. Bilal is 24 years old and lives with his family in Hyderabad. He runs a spare parts shop in his community where he sells auto and motorbike spare parts. He is in his 3rd year in this business. He has been running his business very well at a very young age. 

M. Bilal's business is growing everyday. He is very serious and hardworking. Given the demand in the market, he has figured out that there is a greater need for motorbike spare parts, as the population using motorbikes is increasing. Therefore he has planned to buy more spare parts like barrels, batteries, pistons and rings, circlips and gaskets, etc. It is not possible to purchase more parts with his current income which is why he has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for his spare parts shop.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 38-year-old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in rearing animals and earning salary for extra income. She faces challenges of weather changes, pests and diseases. Her vision is expanding her project of farming and earning more income from dairy farming.

Peninah intends to use the loan to buy cows for her farm.

loans.use: to buy cows for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Maura Antonia

texts.es: Maura de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos. Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida vendiendo ganado y gallinas indias en su localidad, su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo de motorista. Maura desea seguir construyendo un tapial alrededor de su vivienda ya que por el momento solo ha colocado unas láminas deterioradas y alambre de púas lo que causa mucha inseguridad a su familia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, piedra y grava para construir un tapial alrededor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maura, 42, lives in her own home with her common-law husband and two children.  She has proved herself to be an enterprising woman who has been selling cattle and hens from home for three years.  Her husband also contributes to the household economy by working as a driver.  

Maura wants to continue building the wall around the home which now only has a few deteriorated sheets of metal and barbed wire around it, which are not safe for the family.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, stone and gravel to build a wall around the house.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, stone and gravel to build a wall around her home.

loans.name: Argelen

texts.en:
Argelen is a hard working entrepreneur from Sara, Iloilo. She is 39 years old and has three children. She, together with her husband, breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Argelen also operates a fish processing business and owns a passenger boat which is used for a transportation service. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every month.

Argelen’s family is one of those affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost.

Argelen is taking out PHP 20,000 loan assistance to buy additional hogs and feed. She will be utilizing the loan to increase her profit from business. She expects a boost in her business as she expand her piggery.

In the future, Argelen hopes to grow, improve and develop her business. She dreams to send her children to college and see them having diplomas. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is a fish vendor from Manuka. She is 33 years old, married and has two children.
 
The business she has has been operating for 8 years.

Recently, she availed a loan to buy more kilos of fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to send all her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy fertilizer for his garden. He is still in the same business of tea farming alongside rearing goats and planting bananas to sell. He faces challenges of weather changes and price fluctuation. Besides that, he hopes to have a good retirement package and becoming a model farmer in his area. John needs a loan to buy fertilizer for his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his garden.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old man with three children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a retail business, alongside farming and earning a salary. He faces the challenges of low capital and the general price fluctuations of retail products. He hopes to have a well-stocked shop to attract more customers. 

John needs a loan to buy merchandise like soda, beer, sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchadise like soda, beer, sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows and improve on the breeds on his farm.

loans.name: Aracelly Judith

texts.es:
Aracelly es una campesina, humilde y trabajadora con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a mujeres del campo, luchadoras y responsables con su familia.

Es una mujer de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeña aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales gracias a sus padres, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de plátano; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia, Córdoba.

Esta gran mujer tiene como propósito mejorar y consolidar sus cultivos y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de plátano.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresaria y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Ella lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y darle una educación de calidad a sus hijos
texts.en:
Aracelly is a farmer and is very humble and hardworking. She has drive and tenacity, which is a characteristic of women in the countryside who are fighters and responsible for their families.

She is a business-minded woman and learned all of the trades of the country, like crops and raising animals, from a young age thanks to her parents. This is how she now has her own plantain crops, which she now sells in the market in the municipality of Valencia, Córdoba.

This great woman's goal is to improve and consolidate her crops, so she has requested a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers and plantain seeds.

This loan will give her the opportunity to progress as an entrepreneur and as a person. It will also increase her income and allow her to continue to support her home.

The only thing that she wants is to improve her family's quality of life and provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and plantain seeds to improve her crops and generate income for her children's education.

loans.name: Relwende De Yaoghin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Léontine est responsable du groupe RELWENDE DE YAOGHIN. Mariée, elle mère de sept (07) enfants. Le plus âgé à vingt (20) ans et le moins âgé à huit (08) ans. Les sept (07) vont à l’école et elle a douze (12) personnes en charge.
Mme fait du jardinage depuis trois (03) ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les zones environnantes.
Elle veut s’acheter 50 plats de la noix de karité car elle change d’activité pour attendre la période favorable pour le jardinage. Actuellement il y a trop d’eau donc le jardinage ne donne pas.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour scolariser ses enfants et pour les besoins de la famille. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille et surtout préparer l’avenir des enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Léontine is the leader of Relwende de Yaoghin Group. She is married and the mother of seven children. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is eight. All seven go to school and Mrs. Léontine has 12 people in her care.

Mrs. Léontine has been gardening for three years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding areas. She wants to purchase 50 containers of shea nuts because she is changing businesses in order to take advantage of the best time for gardening. There is currently too much water, so gardening isn't yielding anything.

Mrs. Léontine wants to use her profits to send her children to school and for the family's needs. She hopes to expand her business and better care for her family and, above all, to prepare for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 containers of shea nuts, since she's changing businesses to take advantage of the best time for gardening.

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en:
Saverino is a thirty-eight-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening, alongside farming. He started this business to increase his income inflow and look after his family. He has hardships of competition, changes in weather and price fluctuations. However he has a vision of owning a big farm.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening for his farm.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is asking for $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as fish, milks, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, noodles, bread, beer, coca cola and sprite. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Regina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy Fish,milks,cigarettes,sugar,salt,coffee,noodles ,bread,beer,cocacola and sprite

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en: Mavzuna is a student of the first course, at Russia-Tajikistan Slavic University. She studies at the faculty of jurisprudence. She studies well and she is going to be a highly qualified lawyer, in future. Mavzuna lives with her mother. Her mother is a business woman. Mavzuna must pay for tuition, because she wants to continue her education in the university. Mavzuna’s mother has not enough money now. So, Mavzuna is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for her tuition. She really needs your financial support. She awaits your mercy and generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 40-year-old, married woman, from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband and four kids -- two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Khetam works in a sewing workshop, to help her husband meet part of the family's expenses.

Khetam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. By taking this loan, Khetam will be able to improve the quality of her work and increase her productivity. This will help her to provide better living conditions for her kids. Khetam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is one of the tricycle operators within his community. He is 53 years old and has two children. Being a responsible father, he wants to give his family a better standard of living. He aims to strengthen his business and generate sufficient income to meet the needs of his family. 

To be able to continue using his motorcycle, he would like to take out a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy oil, lubricants, accessories and spare parts needed for its maintenance. He hopes that he will obtain his requested loan so that he can use his motorcycle and provide safe transportation for his passengers.

loans.use: to buy oil, lubricants, accessories and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a heavy truck to start his own business as a transportation service provider so he can deliver construction materials.

loans.name: Oscar Rául

texts.es:
Oscar  de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, la falta de motivación al estudio lo llevaron a dedicarse a trabajar. Esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja con él en el mismo local pero en negocios diferentes, ella también tiene negocio propio, tiene un tigomoney lo que le genera un ingreso extra como pareja, nadie más vive con ellos.
	
Él se dedica a la reparación de celulares, tiene un punto de atención donde también cuenta con el servicio de un cyber, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a la actividad desde que estaba en el bachillerato, le gustaban los aparatos electrónicos y es así como fue aprendiendo, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique.  El negocio lo tiene en la casa donde vive, nadie más se involucra en la actividad. Anteriormente, se le tramito un crédito con la línea kiva, el que necesitaba para comprar equipo lo cual así lo hizo, compro un escritorio y su respectiva silla también una vitrina donde exhibe artículos para teléfonos. Lo que le ha llevado a dar un mejor servicio. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  artículos para teléfonos, teléfonos celulares, entre otros, la necesidad satisfecha es el poder cubrir los gastos y luego poner la mercadería a la venta. 

Desea seguir prestando su servicio y  poco a poco ir creciendo las ventas y los clientes, irse preparando desde ya económicamente para cuando venga su primer descendiente y tener una estabilidad para él y los suyos. Las ganancias serán dirigidas a la compra de más mercadería  y al pago de la cuota, con lo que ampliara el negocio adquiriendo más mobiliario para la exposición de la mercadería.
texts.en:
Oscar is 20 years old and studied through high school. His lack of motivation to study led him to dedicate himself to work. He has a partner who works in the same location but at different businesses. She also has her own business, a Tigo Money (money transfer company). No one else lives with them.
	
He works repairing telephones. He has a sales location and also an online service. He has been doing this for four years, since he was in high school. He likes electronics and that is how he learned. He does not have any other businesses. His business is located in his home and no one else is involved in the business. He took out a previous loan through Kiva, which he needed to purchase equipment, which he did. He purchased a desk and chair, and a case to display items for telephones, which have allowed him to provide better service.

He will use the loan that he is requesting to purchase items for telephones, cellular telephones, and other things. This will allow him to cover expenses and put merchandise up for sale.

He hopes to continue to provide this service and, little by little, grow his sales and customers to prepare himself financially for when he has his first child, so that he can provide stability. His earnings will be used to purchase more merchandise and to make the payments. He will expand his business by acquiring more furniture to display the merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase items for telephones, cellular phones, etc., which will allow him to cover expenses and put the merchandise up for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a forty-six-year-old hardworking married man with seven children aged 18, 16, 14, 10, 6, 4 and 2 years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in beekeeping alongside selling maize, beans and coffee as his main source of income. He started this business to have a better life. He faces a challenge of competition and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce and catering for his family needs.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize, beans and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: fabric, thread, needles and other accessories needed to make her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing inventory to sell at his store along with food products

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille lives in Ozamiz City with her family. To make a living, Cecille owns and operates a flower garden aside from her grocery store business. Cecille has been planting and harvesting flowers for four years and earns well for the family needs.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying seedlings to raise. Recently, she took a new loan to cover farm fertilization costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover farm fertilization costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta  has been running a general store for many years, earning well to provide for her family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She always wants improvement to her business for she wants a better living for the family. With this, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods in order to increase sales.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling household consumables (like wheat flour and maize flour) from home, to her neighbours. She faces a challenge in her business, of delayed payments from people who buy on credit. Amina dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Annaitherasa Shg - Ambapoor Group

texts.en:
Pugalenthi (holding a board with the SHG name) and fifteen of her friends hail from Ambapoor village of Ariyalur District in Tamil Nadu. All of them are working to help supplement their family income. 

These women, apart from working hard all day long, also need to labor in front of the traditional “chulha” stoves while cooking. These stoves emit a lot of smoke, which is a health hazard for the whole family and especially the women. Also, the families need to spend an average of Rs. 200 for the firewood and additional expenses towards medical needs.

So, Pugalenthi and her friends have approached People's Action for Transformation (PAT), Micrograam’s field partner, which promotes fuel-efficient cookstoves as part of their energy initiative. The benefits of the Greenway cookstove are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO and CO2, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability; they are also maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels, such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal, and dry dung, and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost.

In order to buy these cookstoves, Pugalenthi and her friends have formed the Annaitherasa Self-Help Group and are seeking a group loan, which is repayable in easy installments. Your loan will not only help these women in preventing respiratory diseases, but also help the environment.

loans.use: to buy a fuel-efficient cookstove.

loans.name: Sumarni

texts.en:
Sumarni is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has one son and two daughters. She has a grocery shop to increase the family's income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home.
 
The sanitation will allow her and her family to have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to  build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло добрый человек. Ему 19 лет. Сунатулло студент второго курса. Он учится успешно. Сунатулло уже во второй раз обращается в ИМОН за займом. Предыдущий займ он погасил во время, и имеет хорошее кредитное досье.  Данное время он запрашивает займ для того, чтобы оплатить учебный договор. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Его родители не смогли помочь ему и поэтому этот займ его последняя надежда. Он ждет вашу доброту. Будущем он хочет стать высококвалифицированным специалистом.
texts.en: Sunatullo is a kind person. He is 19 years old. Sunatullo is a 2nd year student. He studies successfully. Sunatullo comes to IMON for a loan for the second time. He repaid his previous loan on-time and has a good credit history. At the present time, he is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition. He is not married and lives with his parents. His parents could not help him and this is why this loan is his last hope. He awaits your kindness. In the future, he wants to become a highly qualified specialist.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Ziyat

texts.ru:
Зият жительница района Джиликуль. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем. Зият проживает с мужем и детьми. У нее двое детей. Зият на протяжении пятнадцати лет занимается животноводством у себя дома. Заниматься этим бизнесом научил ее отец. Зият занимается разведением скота вместе со своей семьей. Этот вид деятельности для нее является семейным. 
Зият берет кредит для закупа овец и бычков.
texts.en: Ziyat is a resident of the Jilikul district. She is 55 years old and married. Ziyat lives with her husband and children. She has two children. Ziyat has been involved in animal husbandry at home for fifteen years. Her father taught her this business. Ziyat is involved in raising livestock with her family. This is their family business. Ziyat is requesting this loan to buy sheep and bulls.

loans.use: to buy sheep and bulls and continue the family business

loans.name: Botirjon

texts.ru: Ботирчон молодой и умный человек. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Ботирчон после окончания средней школы поступил в Энергетический колледж. Данное время он является студентом 4 курса. Ботирчон учится отлично и хорошо. Он любит читать книги и газеты. В свободное время он посещает интернет кафе. Он всегда старается расширить свой кругозор. Ботирчон активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета, а также он работает после занятий в цемент-завод. У него очень большая семья. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Botirjon is a young and smart person. He is not married and lives with his parents. Botirjon was accepted to the Energy College after completing school. He is currently a 4th year student there. Botirjon studies excellently and well. He loves to read books and newspapers. He visits an internet cafe in his free time. He always tries to expand his outlook. Botirjon actively participates in all of the university events and also works at a cement plant after his studies. He has a very big family. He has to pay for his tuition, but does not have money. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 US dollars. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his college tuition

loans.name: Minjchim

texts.en: Mrs. Minjchimeg, 35 years old, is a married borrower from the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She lives with husband and children in Ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic house, on a plot of land. She ran a tailoring business in Ulaanbaatar city during 1999-2001. She has been working in a local company as an assistant and restarted her tailoring business in 2008 and moved to Tosontsengel in 2012. She also mentioned that she wants to expand her business, hire assistant workers and help them learn and start their own businesses. She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase materials for producing Deel, Mongolian traditional clothing, ordered by her local customers. She is a talented and hardworking lady.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing Deel (Mongolian traditional clothing)

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with six children who are all in school.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more case of beverages to sell to customers.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more case of beverages to sell to customers.

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
En esta ocasión Irma solicita un nuevo crédito para cubrir el pago de un producto de revista, como perfumens, cosmeticos, ropa, ya que todavía no a lo grado reunir todo el dinero, por lo que está haciendo un nuevo trámite para solventar y cuando le vayan pagando los clientes a ella el producto ira cancelando el préstamo. 

Debido a que hace poco tiempo, ella se esta involucrando en las ventas de articilos personales por catalogo y este es el pedido que le ha venido este mes.
texts.en: This time Irma is requesting a new loan to cover the cost of mail-order products such as perfume, cosmetics, and clothes since she still hasn't managed to save enough money for it. That's why she's once again doing this process so she can pay the cost, and as she receives payments from the customers she'll be able to pay off the loan. She just recently got involved in selling personal items in catalogues and this is the delivery order that she received this month.

loans.use: To cover the costs of mail-order products such as perfume, cosmetics, clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 17 years old and is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Criminology. She is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Christine needs 6,000 PHP to pay for the First Semester tuition fees of the 2014-15 school year.

When she graduates, Christine plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old hardworking married woman with three children who are 10, 8 and 6 years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the selling of secondhand clothes as her main source of income. The main reason for venturing into this business was to cater to her family needs, though she faces a challenge of competition and seasonal markets for her clothes. She has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique and educating her children to the university.

She is requesting a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chhanda

texts.en:
Chhanda, 50 years old, is a married woman and the mother of a son. She is from the rural village of Subhasnagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her son is a student and is in grade twelve. She studied until grade ten, and after that, she was married.

Chhanda's husband, 51-year-old Alok, does a job in a factory. Chhanda is an optimistic and entrepreneurial lady. She decided to help her family financially with her earnings. For this purpose, she started her business of selling saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India.

Chhanda started her business from her house. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris from the wholesale market to fulfill the demands of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family. With the growing needs of her family and the increasing educational expenses of her son, she started her business to give financial support to her family. 

She is a successful entrepreneur. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and her plans are to use the profit from her business for the betterment of her family members and to get ahead in her business.

She dreams to admit her son to a renowned school, and she thanks her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Muhammad Ashfaq

texts.en:
M. Ashfaq belongs to Hyderabad Karachi. He is a young businessman of 28 years, and he owns a grocery store in his community. He is married and has two children. He has been carrying out his business activities well. He has been in this business for over eight years.

Now, he plans to increase his sales by purchasing more stock, to increase his customer base. Therefore, he has decided to apply for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, in order to increase his earnings.

He dream is to educate his children and provide them with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Eladio Amilcar

texts.es: Eladio de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre luchador que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración de estructuras metálicas como: puertas, balcones, portones, etc. Además buscando darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia tiene una pequeña siembra de güisquil, la cual vende y aparta cierta cantidad para el consumo familiar. Eladio desea construir un pequeño cuarto junto a su vivienda el cual servirá como dormitorio ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía su vivienda es bastante pequeña. Por lo anterior Eladio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un cuarto junto a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eladio, 34, lives in his own house with his wife and their 2 children aged 14 and 12.  He is tenacious man who has been making metal structures such as doors, security bars, gates, and other metal items for 15 years.  In addition, seeking to give his family a better quality of life, he has a small plot where he grows chayote.  He uses part of the crop for his family's consumption and sells the rest.

Eladio wants to add a small room to his house which will serve as a bedroom, because, as you can see in the photograph his house is quite small. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and steel.  In addition, he will pay for the labor needed to build the room he is adding to his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to add a room to his house

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Tulkarm city. He lives with his wife and one small kid. Mohammad started his own project recently, which is a workshop for making bricks. He uses new machines and frames. Mohammad would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more frames for making bricks. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his productivity and his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo in his bricks workshop

loans.use: to buy more frames to make bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in corn, chicken, lime powder, tomatoes, banana leaves, etc.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Riziki has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Riziki dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Isfandiyor

texts.ru: Исфандиёр молодой и энергичный человек. Он родился в 1996 году на северной части страны в семье простого рабочего. Его родители как типичные местные жители занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Исфандиёр с детства всегда мечтал получить высшее образование и служить своему народу для улучшения страны. В этом году он успешно окончил среднюю школу, и его родители поддержали его, чтобы он мог осуществить свою мечту. Он поступил в университет. Теперь Исфандиёр студент 1 курса и он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу. Поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 1400 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Isfandiyor is an energetic young man. He was born in 1996 in the northern part of Tajikistan to an ordinary working family. His parents raise livestock and plant crops as many locals do. Isfandiyor has always dreamed of receiving a college degree and serving the people of his country. This year he successfully finished high school and his parents supported him in realizing his dream. He applied to university and is now a first year student, but he needs to pay his tuition. This is why he is asking for a loan of 1400 USD. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay his tuition

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиёр  мужчина в возрасте  40 лет ,женат. Он по специальности парикмахер . Пять лет назад  открыл свой парикмахерский салон,которым владеет по нынешнее время. Бахтиёр является специалистом по мужским стрижкам. Он участвовал в соревнованиях по парикмахерскому искусству ,которые проходят в рамках конкурсной программы ,посещал курсы по повышению квалификации парикмахеров.Он пользуется успехом среди клиентов. 
Бахтиер планирует сделать ремонт в салоне и нуждается в приобретении инструментов для стрижки и расчесывания волос,но на данный момент не имеет нужной суммы.  Поэтому Бахтиер обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is a 40-year-old married man. He is a barber by trade. He opened his own barber shop five years ago and owns it to this day. Bahtiyor is a specialist in men's haircuts. He has participated in barber art competitions, held as part of a contest program, and attended courses to increase his barber qualifications. His success is well known among clients. Bahtiyor wants to make repairs in his shop and needs to purchase tools for haircuts and styling, but does not currently have the required amount. This is why Bahtiyor came to Arvand for the financial support. He is grateful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to make repairs in his barber shop and to purchase tools for haircuts and styling

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es soltera, tiene un hijo que esta en colegio, vive en una casa en alquiler ocupando dos habitaciones,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como administradora por mas de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada, y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación,educación,alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
Cecilia necesita crédito para cancelar un curso de actualizacion.
El sueño de Cecilia es tener su casa propia para brindarle comodidad y seguridad a su hijo,también desea tener su  propio negocio de cocina ya que ella tambien se dedica a la cocina
texts.en:
Cecilia is single and she has a son who is in school. She rents two rooms of a house that is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she works as an administrator for more than eight hours a day in a private business, and with her earnings she must cover the expenses for food, education, rent, and utilities.

Cecilia needs a loan to pay for a refresher course.  Cecilia’s dream is to have her own home in order to provide comfort and security to her son. She would also like to have her own culinary business as she also enjoys cooking.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course

loans.name: Arely

texts.es: Arely de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 20 años y su nieta de 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 12 años posee una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera  necesidad como: arroz, bebidas frías, azúcar, maíz, golosinas, jabón, etc. Además aprovechando la clientela de la tienda, tiene venta de tortillas frente a su vivienda. Como podemos observar en la fotografía el corredor de Arely es de tierra y se encuentra en hoyo por lo que cada vez que llueve el agua se acumula y  esto le genera inconvenientes, por lo que desea encementar esa zona de su vivienda y el piso del baño. Por lo anterior Arely solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra necesaria para encementar el piso del corredor y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
