Arely is 49 years old and lives in a home that she owns with her spouse, their 20 year-old son and her nine year-old granddaughter.  She is an enterprising woman who for the past 12 years has owned a small store that sells basic goods such as: rice, cold drinks, sugar, corn, snacks, soap, etc.  Additionally, taking advantage of her store's customer base, she sells tortillas in front of her house.  

As can be seen in the picture, Arely's patio is made of dirt and has holes because every time it rains, the water puddles and causes holes.  For this reason, she wants to cement this area of her home as well as the bathroom floor.  In order to do this, Arely is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel and to pay for the necessary labor to cement the patio and bathroom floors of her home.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to cement the floor of the patio and bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo presta servicios de instalaciones de puerta, ventanas, rejas y realiza ajuste en general es todo un experto en el tema de acero, aprendió trabajando como ayudante en una cerrajería y con la ayuda de microcréditos ha comenzó a comprar poco a poco su herramienta para ser una persona independiente.

Es padre de 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años y vive con su esposa en un núcleo familiar donde no sobran los recursos pero pro la buena gestión de Guillermo puede gozar de un estudio y una buena alimentación.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de herramienta de trabajo; sierra circular, destornilladores, taladro, pulidora y herramienta de mano para fácil desplazamiento.

Con el crédito podrá tener un mejor inventario de herramienta para prestar un óptimo servicio y ser cada día más solicitado.
texts.en:
Guillermo installs doors and windows, gates, and makes general adjustments to things.  He is an expert in all things iron and learned to do this as a helper for a locksmith.  He started his own business with the help of loans.  He bought tools little by little so he could become independent.

He is the father of 2 children, ages 12 and 9 and lives with his wife as a family unit.  Their resources are just enough but thanks to Guillermo’s management they can enjoy education and food.

He is asking for this loan to buy work tools, such as a circular saw, screwdrivers, a drill, a sander, and hand tools.

This loan will allow him to have a better inventory of tools to provide optimal service and be more in demand.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Uldan

texts.ru:
Улдан проживает в районе Джиликуль. Ей 55 лет. Она спокойная и ответственная женщина. Улдан по причине болезни оставила свой бизнес два года назад. Ранее она занималась торговлей продуктов питания на рынке. Сейчас, сезонно Улдан занимается растениеводством в небольшом участке земли, при доме. Улдан поправилась после тяжелой болезни. 
Улдан берет кредит для того чтобы возобновить бизнес. Только не в сфере торговли продуктов питания, а торговли одежды. Она планирует привести школьную одежду с рынка Корвон, города Душанбе и с рынка города Кургантюбе. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Uldan lives in the Jilikul district. She is 55 years old. She is a calm and responsible woman. Due to her health, Uldan abandoned her business two years ago. She was previously involved in selling food products at a market. Now, Uldan is seasonally involved in agriculture on a small plot of land by her house. Uldan has recovered after a severe illness. Uldan is requesting this loan to restore her business, not in the sales of food products, but rather in clothing sales. She is planning to bring in school clothing from the Korvon market in Dushanbe and from a market in Quargan-Tube. She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy school clothing in order to start her business

loans.name: Kevin Fernando

texts.es: Kevin de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Él es un joven emprendedor que se gana la vida comprando blusas y camisas de manta para luego, teñirlas con añil o bordarlas, y posteriormente venderlas y es así como logra mantener la economía familiar. Kevin desea ampliar su negocio comprando más blusas, camisas, añil e hilo de bordar para tener más variedad para sus clientes. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, camisas, hilos de bordar y añil para teñir las camisas y blusas.
texts.en: Kevin is 22 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their son who is 5 years old.  He is a hardworking young man that makes a living buying blouses and woven cotton shirts.  He later dyes the shirts or embroiders them to later sell them.  It's through this work that he is able to maintain his family finances.  Kevin wishes to expand his business to buy more blouses, shirts, indigo and embroidery yarn to have more variety for his clients.  It's for this reason that he solicits a loan from FUSAI to invert in blouses, shirts, embroidery yarns and indigo to dye shirts and blouses.

loans.use: To invest in: blouses, shirts, embroidery yarns and indigo to dye shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is a vigorous, obliging and hardworking woman. She is 46 years old, married, and a mother of a lovely daughter who reads in grade 12.  She is married to Subrata, who is 54 years old.  She attended school up to the eighth standard but could not go for higher studies due to the lack of financial resources of her parents.  Her husband studied until grade nine.

Some years ago, Dipa and her husband began working in the tailoring business, making a variety of clothing and providing clothing services to customers directly. Their neighbors are their main customers. She learned the craft through experience and works with the help of her husband every day, generating sufficient resources to support her family with the economic burden of the home.

Currently, she is motivated to ask for this loan from BJS to purchase another sewing machine in order to grow her business to satisfy customer demand and to generate more income for her family. The festivals season is arriving so they are expecting more orders from their customers.

With this new machine, she will be able to greatly enhance the work already being done and she will be able to get ahead in her job.

Dipa shows that she intends to continue putting a lot of effort into her work. She wants to expand her business and be able to generate opportunities for jobs, guaranteeing economic stability to give her family a better quality of life.  She aspires to provide a better education to her daughter.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 65 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como negociante en pequeño actividad que realiza en su comunidad y la cual le ha permitido dar solidez económica a su hogar, Francisco compra y vende ganado desde hace 36 años, además su experiencia le ha permitido trabajar como consultor de ganado en una hacienda, su esposa lo apoya con la economía familiar por medio de la venta de gallinas  que ella cría y vende. Francisco desea construir un corredor con piso encementado y techo en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines, además pagará mano de obra para la construcción de un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 65 years old and he lives in his own house with his wife. He is a hard working man who makes a living as a small businessman in his community; this has allowed him to provide economic wellbeing in his household. Francisco purchases and sells livestock in a ranch. His wife also supports the family economy by selling chickens; chickens that she raises and sells.  

Francisco wishes to build a hallway with cement floor and a roof in his house, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets and idlers. He will also use the loan to pay workers that will build the hallway in his house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets and idlers. This loan will also allow him to pay workers who will build a hallway in his home.

loans.name: Amilcar Leodan

texts.es: Amílcar de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida elaborando estructuras metálicas como: puertas, ventanas y portones de hierro, actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace 5 años. Amílcar  adquirió anteriormente un crédito con FUSAI con el cual cambió el techo de su vivienda y repelló las paredes de la misma, actualmente Amílcar desea instalar un portón de hierro con tela metálica en la entrada de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ángulos de hierro, tubos de hierro, tela metálica y electrodos para soldadura eléctrica para elaborar e instalar un portón de hierro en la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en: Amílcar is 38 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children aged 4 and 9. He is a hard-working man who makes his living making metal structures like doors, windows and gates. He has done this business for five years from his house. Amílcar received a loan previously from FUSAI to replace the roof of his house and plaster the walls. Now Amílcar wants to install a metal gate made of wire at the entrance to his house. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy angle iron, metal tubing, wire and electrodes for his electric solderer to fabricate and install a gate at the entrance to his house.

loans.use: to buy angle iron, metal tubing, wire and electrodes for an electric solderer to fabricate and install a metal gate at the entrance to his house.

loans.name: Felix Segundo

texts.es:
Felix es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su esposa quien lo apoya de manera incondicional.
Desde muy joven ha trabajado en las chacras porque su familia era de bajos recursos y tenían que ver la manera de sacar adelante a sus hermanos. Gracias a la amplia experiencia que ha ganando a lo largo de los años hoy es dueño de sus propios terrenos, se dedica principalmente al cultivo de cacao y le va muy bien porque siempre ha brindado productos de excelente calidad y es muy conocido en la zona.
Felix está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar abono orgánico para poder realizar el sostenimiento de sus cultivos de caco, de esta manera su producción mejorará y seguirá trabajando como lo viene haciendo y generando mayores ingresos para vivir una vida tranquila junto a su amada esposa.
texts.en:
Felix is a very hardworking person.  He is 54 years old, married and lives in San Martin with his wife who supports him unconditionally.  From a very young age he has worked on farms because his family was of few means and they had to find a way to get his brothers ahead.  Thanks to the vast experience that he has gained through the years, he is the owner of his own lands.  He primarily dedicates himself to growing cacao, and it has gone very well for him because he always harvest products of excellent quality and he is very well known in the region.  

Felix is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him he will be able to purchase organic fertilizer to be able to sustain his cacao crops.  This way, his production will improve and he will be able to continue working as he has while generating greater earnings so that he can live a tranquil life with his loving wife.

loans.use: maintain his cacao crops.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a forty-seven-year old hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock as his main source of income, though he also earns an extra income from farming. He started this business to have better standards of living. He faces a challenge of foot and mouth diseases though he has a vision of owning a modern farm. 

Robert is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Asumani

texts.en:
Asumani is a thirty five year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income alongside produce selling where he earns more income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He has personal goals of educating his children and becoming a prominent business man. His main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands.
 
He is requesting for a loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La señora Alba se dedica al comercio, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda  actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, sus principales clientes son los de su comunidad donde en la ciudad de Danli.
Doña Alba vende a detalle el fardo de ropa, sus ventas las realiza de lunes a sábado de cada semana, el local donde tiene su negocio es alquilado y es en una muy buen lugar ya que por ahí transitan varias personas hacia Jamastran y el centro de la ciudad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc. y así tener más producto que ofrecerle a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña espera que esta inversión que realice a su negocio le sea mucha ayuda y a su vez le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.


Danlí, Honduras – Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Alba is a woman who dedicates her life to trade.  For 15 years she has had a business selling secondhand clothing.  Her main customers are from her community in the city of Danli.  Alba sells by sack of clothing.  Her store is open Monday through Saturday each week.  The space where she has her store is rented and it is in a good location because there many people pass through from Jamastran and the center of the city.  She requests this loan to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. and this way she will have more products to offer her clients that visit.  She wishes that this inversion in her business will help her and that it would generate the income necessary for her family to get ahead.

Dani, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: José Noe

texts.es:
José de 26 años, su esposa es ama de casa. Ellos actualmente tienen 2 hijos a los cuales aman y cuidan muchísimo.

José se dedica a estructuras metálicas y el negocio esta ubicado en su casa, manifiesta que gracias a su pequeño trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, darles la alimentación necesaria. 

Él ya tiene mucho tiempo de ejercer su propio negocio, José quiere comprar una motocicleta para transportarse mas rápido, la cual la adquirirá con el efectivo del préstamo y lo demás del efectivo lo invertirá en materiales para su trabajo.

José a futuro sueña enseñar a sus hijos un oficio que les permita salir adelante, construir su propio hogar, y que sean unos hombres de provecho.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old.  His wife is a homemaker, and together they have two children who they love and care for very much.  José works with metal structures and his business is located in his home.  He states that thanks to his small business he has been able to get his family ahead, and provide them with food.  He has been involved in this business for a long time. 

José wants to purchase a motorcycle so that he can travel faster.  He will purchase this motorcycle with the money from this loan and with the remainder he will purchase materials for his work.  José dreams that in the future he will be able to teach his children a trade that will allow them to get ahead, build their home home and be good men.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle to travel faster, as well as to purchase materials for his work.

loans.name: Deepaoli Shg- Ambapoor Group

texts.en:
A group of 20 women formed a group named Deepaoli Self-Help Group in Ambapoor, a tiny village in Ariyalur, Tamil Nadu. Most of their fellow villagers, including these 20 women, work during the day as laborers in nearby industries and farms. They make just enough money to return to a home in the evenings and feed themselves and be able to repeat the same thing all over again the next day. It is harder for the women, who also attend to the myriad domestic chores, such as cleaning, washing and cooking. Apart from the physical exertion, it is the lack of respite from the dust and smoke, at work and at home, that takes a toll and makes them susceptible to health hazards. Lung diseases are extremely common.

PAT (Micrograam’s partner) works to address part of the problem. They promote clean, energy-efficient cooking stoves, so that, at least while cooking, the women’s exposure to soot and smoke is minimized. The stoves use dung, agro-waste, etc. as fuel and so, have low CO2 emissions. They are also very cheap to run and help save significant amounts of money. So, Parameswari (featured borrower holding a board with SHG name) and her group have decided to buy these stoves. They are all married and most have young kids. They know it is imperative that they offer their kids as healthy a life as possible, so they can grow up and extricate their families from the poverty spiral they are trapped in. They do not have enough money to buy these stoves outright. They seek to borrow the requisite amount and repay it within the specified time.

loans.use: to buy an energy-efficient cooking stove

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José es un hombre emprendedor y dedicado al negocio propio que es compra y venta de pan, actividad que realiza desde hace 17 años contando con los clientes principales del municipio donde vive  y  de diferentes aldeas.
Don José  las ventas las realiza todos los días de la semana, compra su producto en Tegucigalpa donde le dan un  precio cómodo,  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra  de diferentes tipos de pan como semita, pan blanco, polvorón, donas, enrollado, quesadilla, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don José uno de sus sueños es que su negocio crezca y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.  

Danlí, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Señor José is an enterprising man, and he is devoted to his business, which is the purchase and sale of bread. He has had this occupation for 17 years, with customers mainly from the municipality where he lives and from different villages.

Don José sells every day of the week. He purchases his product in Tegucigalpa, where they give him an agreeable price. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of different types of bread, such as semita (a fluffy, sweet, roll), white bread, polvorón (light, crumbly, shortbread), donuts, rolled bread, quesadillas, etc. 

He hopes that this investment will allow him to earn the income that is necessary to improve his and his family’s quality of life a little. 
One of the dreams of Don José is that his business may grow and that he may be able to continue supporting his family.

Danlí, Honduras—July, 2014

loans.use: to purchase rolls, white bread, shortbread, donuts, rolled bread, quesadillas, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 17, 15, 12, 10 y 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por llevar el sustento diario a su hogar por lo que trabaja como albañil independiente normalmente, pero actualmente por la falta de proyectos se encuentra trabajando como ayudante de estructuras metálicas, actividad que le permite mantener la economía del hogar. José desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda que como se puede observar en la fotografía se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: polines, láminas galvanizadas y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their five children who are aged 17, 15, 12, 10 and 9.  He is a hardworking man who strives to provide for his household daily, which is why he normally works as an independent mason, but currently due to a lack of projects, he is working as an assistant in metal structures, a job that allows him to provide financially for his household.

José hopes to replace the roof on his house, which as can be seen in the picture is in bad shape.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase purlins, galvanized sheet metal and pins to replace the roof of his home.

loans.use: purchase purlins, galvanized sheet metal and pins to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es una persona emprendedora que se dedica al comercio,  sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio propio, que consiste en la elaboración de forma artesanal de canastos de carrizo moro, actividad que realiza en su casa, cuenta con 40 años de experiencia y vende su productos sus todos los días de la semana.
Don Juan cuenta con sus clientes siendo estos las personas que viven en los diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de la ciudad del Danli, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de carrizo material para elaborar su producto y así fortalecer su negocio.
Espera que esta inversión le permita obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su negocio y su familia, uno de sus sueños es poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Danlí, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising person who devotes himself to business.  He earns an income through his business in which he makes artisanal reed baskets in his home.  He has 40 years of experience doing this, and he sells his products every day of the week.  Juan counts on his customers who are the people who live in the different neighborhoods of the city of Danli.

He is seeking a loan to purchase reed, the material that he uses to make his baskets, which will allow him to strengthen his business.  He hopes that this investment will allow him to generate the necessary earnings so that he can get ahead with his business and his family.  One of his dreams is to continue supporting his family.

Danli, Honduras- July, 2014

loans.use: purchase reeds for his business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is 24 years old. She is married and has two little children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Firuza is a sewer. She sews very wonderful dresses. She mainly sews national dresses. Firuza’s husband is a migrant in Russia. So Firuza is the main caregiver of her family and she manages any house problems alone. She is going to increase her working capital and in this way develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy a new sewing machine. In this way she will offer better service to her clients. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 21-year-old university student majoring in civil engineering, and he is in his third year. He lives with his family which consists of eight members in Ajloun/Jordan. 

Bashar is seeking to get his bachelors' degree so that he will find a good job that will make him an additional provider for the family. But he currently doesn't have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto es una excelente persona, tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
A lo largo de su vida, Augusto se ha dedicado a varias labores desde Agricultor, también crianza de animales y venta de abarrotes en una pequeña tienda que ha podido aperturar en su casa. Es una persona que siempre ha luchado por lo que quiere y no le ha importado trabajar día y noche para poder brindar mejores oportunidades en la vida a sus hijos, gracias a esto, sus hijos hoy son personas de bien y apoyan a Augusto de manera incondicional.
Augusto quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá instalar un medidor de fluido eléctrico para su domicilio, de esta manera su esposa sentirá mayor comodidad y seguridad y él continuará disfrutando de su familia por muchas más años.
texts.en:
Augusto is an excellent person.  He is 66 years old and married.  He lives in San Martin with his family.

Throughout his life Augusto has done various jobs from farming to raising animals and selling groceries at a small store that he was able to open at his house.  He is a person who has always struggled for what he wants.  It did not bother him to work day and night in order to be able to provide his family with better life opportunities.  Thanks to this, his children are now good people, and they support Augusto unconditionally.

Augusto wants to improve his family’s quality of life.  That is why he is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With the support they have provided, he will be able to install an electricity meter at his house.  This way his wife will be more comfortable and safer.  He will continue enjoying his family for many more years.

loans.use: to install an electricity meter at his house.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Kalpana is a woman of courage and strength. She is from Maynaguri.  She is a married woman with two sons.  In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity for higher education due to parental poverty so she only studied until fourth grade. But today, she stands as a testimony to the fact that there is no lack of opportunities for those who are willing to work hard. She runs her own cattle-rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. One of her sons is a student in grade three and the other son is too young for school. She lives with the family in Tekatuli village, in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal.

Her husband Manik, 39, is a carpenter by profession who makes small wooden furniture like tables, chairs, stools etc. and sells them locally. His income is not sufficient for the family. So, to help her husband, Kalpana started rearing cattle. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and save for a secure future.
 
With the aim of growing her business and satisfying her customers’ demands, Kalpana seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a new cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With her increased income and savings, Kalpana wants to strengthen the family economy and help her sons continue their education.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Durgaimariamman Shg - Nachiyarpettai Group

texts.en:
Thilagavathi (holding the board with SHG group name) and fourteen other women hailing from Nachiyarpettai in Ariyalur, Tamil Nadu have formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named as Durgaimariamman. 40-year-old Thilagavathi is a daily wage laborer, as are the other members of the group. They work long hours outside only to come back home and spend a lot of time cooking over traditional ‘chulha’ stoves that emit a lot of smoke that is detrimental to their health. The smoke affects the children at home too. Besides, there is always the danger of contracting respiratory ailments hovering over their heads.

So Thilagavathi and her group have approached PAT, which is promoting cook stoves, as part of their energy initiative with the financial support of Micrograam. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are: fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO, CO2, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, and also they are maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. Due to all the above reasons, these cook stoves are preferred by the group. 
 
Thilagavathi and her group are, hence, seeking a loan which is repayable in easy installments, to buy the Greenway cook stoves. Your loan will help these hardworking women to ensure better health for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy the fuel-efficient cook stoves

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 74 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su nieto de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero desde hace 10 años, además su hija tuvo que emigrar al extranjero para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo que tan responsablemente cuida Daniel junto a su esposa. En la vivienda de Daniel se encuentra un tapial de laminas viejas el cual ya comenzó a cambiar por uno de ladrillo  y cemento, gracias al  primer crédito que adquirió con FUSAI pero, actualmente este muro se encuentra a la mitad por lo que no da mayor seguridad a la vivienda. Es por ello que Daniel solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para terminar de construir un muro alrededor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Daniel is 74 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their grandson who is 5 years old. He is a hardworking man who has made a living as a laborer for the past 10 years.  His daughter had to emigrate abroad to give a better quality of life to her son, who is cared for responsibly by Daniel and his wife.  In Daniel's home there are old sheets of tin wall which he has begun to change, one at a time for brick and cement, thanks to the first loan he acquired from FUSAI.  In actuality, the wall is now half which does not allow for good security for his home.  It's for this reason Daniel requests a new loan with FUSAI to purchase: cement, sand, gravel and brick to finish building a wall around his home.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand, gravel and brick to finish building a wall around his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory and bulk shoe making materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow vegetables

loans.name: Las Vendedoras Del Caserío Los Castro Group

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Entre esos grupos se encuentra Juliana de 40 años de edad, ella realiza un enorme esfuerzo para sostener a su familia ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad ella es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños en la vida. (Juliana  se encuentra en 2da de izquierda a derecha)
La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras, ella eligió dicha actividad porque le genera ingresos económico para su familia, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante doce años y lo aprendió de su mama, a ella le gusta realizar esta actividad porque por medio de ello a mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y también la de su comunidad. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de zanahoria en un terreno que tiene disponibles cerca de su casa donde ella vive.
Ella es una buena colaboradora en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se a reunida a ella para emprender juntos la actividad de venta de verduras par que ellas también mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de verduras y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus siembras para obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar sus ventas en el mercado de su comunidad con buenas cosechas. La aspiración de ella es agrandar su negocio y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It is a very warm day.  The biggest market in Sololá is full of people who come and go.  Some of them are buying, others are selling.  Hope dances between the two groups.  You will find Juliana, age 40, among these groups.  She puts forth an enormous effort to support her family.  She has four children, and all of them go to the community school.  She is an enterprising woman with big life dreams.  (Juliana is the second person from the left).

Her business activity is buying and selling vegetables.  She chose this business activity because it generates income for her family.  She has been doing this for 12 years, and she learned from her mother.  She likes doing this because it is how she has improved her family’s living conditions, and she has improved her community.  The second business activity that she does is growing carrots on land that is available close to her house.

She makes good contributions to her community.  That is why a group of women have joined her to undertake the business activity of selling vegetables together.  They do this so that they, too, will improve their living conditions.

She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fertilizers.  This way she will improve her crops in order to get good harvests.  She will also improve her sales at the community market by having good harvests.  

Her aspiration is to expand her business and to build houses so that the children will have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
 
Anzazi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Anzazi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Alo

texts.en:
Alo, 45, lives with her husband and one daughter in Mouyamari, a small village in the Jalpaiguri district near Burdwan, West Bengal. The village is far away from Kolkata distance wise, and in terms of facilities and opportunities, it couldn’t be farther away. Basic infrastructure is lacking, connectivity to Kolkata is poor, and earning opportunities are limited.  She is a housewife who looks after her husband and daughter and in her spare time, helps her husband in his work. Her daughter is continuing with her bachelor's degree.

Alo's husband Subrata, age 52, is engaged in the business of selling ladies garments such as frocks, petticoats, blouses and sarees. Alo also helps her husband in this business after managing her household work. Unlike many other men in the village who have chosen to travel to far off cities in search of better work, he has chosen to stay with his family and run the business from home.  Their customers are their relatives, friends and neighbors.  Alo and her husband realize there is a great demand for the garments, but their stock is too low to remain viable in the long run. They need to purchase more stock of garments, as they have now decided to focus entirely on this business. But the main obstacle is capital.

Alo learned from her neighbors that BJS (Kiva's partner) gives business loans to rural needy women.  So she has taken a loan from them to purchase more clothing to increase their stock. She is a woman of determination whose goal in life is to grow the business in order to give a higher education to their only daughter and provide financial sustenance to the family.

She appreciates the help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-one-year-old single woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a bar as her main source of income, and practices farming as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself and her children as a loving mother. High rental and license fees are a problem, but she has hopes of expanding her business into a big depot of alcohol.

Mary is requesting for a loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Tsendbazar

texts.en:
Tsendbazar is a 61-year-old married borrower from Tosontsengel soum, Zavhan province of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his 22-year-old daughter in a ger (Mongolian traditional nomadic house). His wife and daughter are unemployed. 

He has been working as a veterinarian in his village and retired a few years back. Now he is selling veterinary vaccines and other medicines for living. He is having his business grow further, thanks to his good reputation among herders and local residents. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of vaccines and medicines to run his veterinary sales and diagnostician business.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of vaccines and medicines to run his veterinary sales and diagnostician business

loans.name: Koem Hoirng

texts.en:
Koem Hoirng is 41 years old and a married woman with two dependent children. She lives in a small village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. For the last ten years, she and her husband have managed a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. They grow rice and sell the crop to local dealers. Their farmland is located near their house and the net profit that this couple can make is US $4 a day.

Koem Hoirng wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can improve sanitation, promote her family members' health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz, a mother of four, operates a retail store and is has a video-k machine for rent in their village in order to make a living. She has provided this entertainment for 3 years and she earns enough to sustain the family.  

She is taking a loan from GDMPC  to cover video-k machine maintenance costs. 

In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs of her video-k machine

loans.name: Flory

texts.en:
Flory is 42 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Flory has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Flory requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Flory has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Flory would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 65 years old and married with six children. 

Ruben is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ruben requested a 40000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for his business.

Ruben has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and he has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this work.

In the future, Ruben would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for his business

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is a 21-year-old university student majoring in medical registration, and she is in her fourth year. She also works in the evenings at a designing company. 

Raya is seeking to get her bachelor's degree so that she will find a good job in her study field in order to earn a better income and start helping her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a forty-seven-year-old, hard-working married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the produce business as his main source of income, though he also practices farming where he earns an extra income. 

He started this business to sustain his family and educate his children. He faces a challenge of weather changes that affect his produce business and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands. He has a vision of expanding his business into a big store supplying people within and outside his area.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize, ground nuts, and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, ground nuts, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-two-year-old, hard-working married man with two children aged 5 and 2 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce alongside farming where he grows bananas, cassava and coffee to earn an extra income. 

He started this business to have a better life. He faces a challenge of competition, high transport costs, and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce and catering to his family's needs.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans  to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanakombo operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwanakombo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Iftikhar Qaisar

texts.en:
Iftikhar is 38 years old and married. He lives in Hyderabad. He owns a nursery in his community. He is a humble, hard-working farmer and learnt agricultural work at a very young age. He grows the flowers which are then picked and sold in the market place in his community. He is seeking a loan to invest in buying a variety of flowers in bulk. The purchase will let him have more variety and number. He will continue to care for his flowers and improve their productivity, providing better income with each sale. 

Iftikhar says that his greatest desire is to create financial stability for his family and give his family better conditions for living.

loans.use: to purchase flowers in bulk for his nursery.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
The Shalom borrowers’ group is made up of six women who have been in business for some years and joined forces in order to benefit from financial support allowing them to strengthen their businesses. They sell soft drinks, groceries, hair products and underwear. 

The group’s representative, Felicia, sells soft drinks for 6 years. Felicia is married and the mother of three. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her family’s nutrition and business. Felicia would like to see her capital grow in order to increase her sales volume and meet customer demand. She will buy soft drinks such as Malta Guinness, Coca-Cola, Fanta and Sprite.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Esmeralda is engaged in nipa weaving for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Nipa is used as a roofing materials and can also be used as mats and others. 
As of now, Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy additional materials in nipa weaving like nipa palm leaves, bamboo sticks and nylon. With this, she will be able to weave more nipa and sell it to her customers. In the future, Esmeralda hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional materials in nipa weaving like nipa palm leaves, bamboo sticks and nylon

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga tiene 37 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, vive en el Distrito de Morropón junto con sus padres, la vida en el distrito se desarrolla pacificamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales. Está ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Olga se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, piqueos, cerveza, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 2 años, también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de productos como cerveza y maíz para preparar la chicha de jora y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias, y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 37 years old, single, and lives in the District of Morropon with her parents.  Life in the district develops peacefully.  In the area of business, the inhabitants work in agriculture, livestock and the breeding of animals.  It is located in the Province of Morropon that belongs to the Region of Piura, in the north shore of Peru.  

Olga dedicates herself to the sale of traditional corn liquor, fish, and beer, which she has been doing for two years.  She also dedicates herself to the breeding of poultry, in the back part of her home.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevo soles for the purchase of products like beer and corn to prepare the traditional corn liquor and thus generate higher revenue, better earnings and through this improve her quality of life as well as her family's.

loans.use: requests a loan to purchase products like beer and corn to prepare traditional corn liquor and thus generate higher revenue.

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He, together with his wife, has been engaged in a landscaping and garden decorating business for years to earn a living and he was able to repay his previous loan.

Roldan would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening tools and supplies. He is requesting an amount of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants and other gardening and landscaping supplies needed to improve their service and also their profits.

In the future, Roldan desires to have more regular clients and he also dreams to buy his own car. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy plants, ornamental rocks, grasses and other landscaping supplies.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old.  She is married and has five children, two of whom attend school.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 25 years. She also earns an income from farming rice.  She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.  Prior to requesting this loan, Rosario has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 32 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  
Melanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Melanie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Rushango Bafumbo Twimukye Assocation Group

texts.en:
Calveri is a forty-nine-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income alongside farming where he earns an extra income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He has personal goals of educating his children to a level of self-sustainability and becoming a prominent business man. His main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands plus the constant price fluctuations.
 
He is requesting for a loan to buy more general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
Durga, 27 years old, lives with her husband Binay and their three children (two sons and one daughter), of whom two are students of grade 1 and grade 5.  The other is too small to go to school. They live in a small village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.  

She is a homemaker and her husband runs a grocery shop which sells essential commodities of everyday needs like rice, oil, salt, sugar, flour, biscuits, etc.  He is the main breadwinner for the family and Durga helps her husband in his grocery shop, managing her household works.

Besides aspiring to provide their children good education, Durga and her husband also hope to save enough and access better living conditions. To that end, they work very hard and save diligently from their earning.  By carefully managing their expenses, Durga manages to set aside money every month towards providing for her children's future education costs.

To generate more income to cover all the costs of a five-member family smoothly, Durga wants to expand her business by adding more items in her inventory for sale. To stock and store this inventory, she needs financial help.

She requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in these purchases. With the expansion, her income has been projected to increase substantially. She wants to use the additional income to admit their children in renowned schools. She will also have the option of reinvesting these savings in her business for further growth, and the improved income and savings can help them achieve their simple goals.

She thanks her lenders because their loan will take a hardworking young mother and her family a step closer to achieving their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for their grocery store.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey was born in Nyeri and moved to Nairobi to start his own business. During his stay in the city he met a few friends and formed a welfare group. The group recently discovered Fresh Life toilets and thought it would be wise to invest in the franchise. The group hopes to see a cleaner community and reduce exposure to sanitation related ailments. 

Geoffrey seeks a loan on behalf of his group to help them purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. The toilets will be set up in a high human traffic area which has no sanitation facilities. He hopes that the pay-per-use toilet will be successful and generate enough money to enable them repay the loan as well as invest in additional facilities.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene un sueño muy determinante ser independiente y NO TRABAJARLE A NADIE, en base a esto quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía como lo es, hebillas, correas, bolsos, aretes, diademas, productos en murado y acero. aparte comprar las vitrinas para su exhibición y ya tiene el local (ver foto) lo que da constancia de su determinacion y su responsabilidad y compromiso.  

Es una mujer sin hijos que quiere aprovechar su juventud para trabajar para ella y sus padres y nunca más llegarle a trabajar para nadie solo rendirle cuentas a su madre, por eso quiere que la poyen en su proyecto de independizarse y promete puntualidad en las cuotas pues sabe que si la apoyan podrá cumplir su sueño y devolverá con puntualidad y agradecimiento la confianza depositada en ella.
texts.en:
Diana’s dream is extremely focused: to become independent and ACCOUNTABLE to nobody. That is why she requesting a loan to begin her own business to sell merchandise such as strap buckles, belts, bags, earrings, diadems, and steel and wall supplies. Additionally, she will also purchase display cases to exhibit her products. She also has the location for her store (refer to image); this displays her level of determination, responsibility and commitment. 

She is a woman who does not have any children; she wishes to enjoy her youth, working for herself and her parents. She does not wish to work for anybody ever again and she only wants to be held accountable to her mother that is why she is requesting support for her project to become independent. She promises that she will be punctual with her dues because she knows that with your support she can accomplish her dream; she will give back with timeliness and confidence the trust that has been bestowed upon her.

loans.use: to start a business; she will purchase two display cases, strap buckles, belts, bags, earrings, diadems and steel and wall supplies so that she is not held accountable to any boss.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her shoe making business

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol, 43, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one child in school and two married children. 

To make a living, she works as a farmer in small rice field located near her house.  So far, she has been in this farming business for 10 years and can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

To accelerate her farming operation, she would like to have a plowing machine which can help her in plowing process and carry the heavy things from home to her farmland. Now she is requesting a loan from HKL to buy a used plowing machine to use in her farming operation. 

She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a used plowing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plants for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building his house and to purchase inventory for his shoemaking business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mariamu operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mariamu dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large numbers of livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get an education to cover the school fee for one of her kids who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in accounting.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 22-year-old university student majoring in sports, and she is in her third year. Her father works at a workshop. 

Khadija is seeking to find a good job in her study field after getting her bachelors' to start earning income that will help her support her family. But unfortunately she currently doesn't have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Because Lina is a conservative lady, she asked her younger sister to take her place in the picture. Lina is a 28-year-old married lady living in Mafraq-Jordan. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Her sister Ghadeer, appearing in the photo, is a university student majoring in accounting and management law, and she is in her second year. She is planning to get her bachelors' so that she will start helping her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, Lina decided to help her by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her sisters' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom (in picture) lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five children-three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are garment factory workers and others attend school.
Sreymom stays at home and does housework. Main source of income is from her husband and children’s salary. Her husband is a mason. 
She wants to repair the walls of her house because it breaks. Hence she decided to apply for a loan and she will use the rest of the loan to concrete her house foundation.

loans.use: to concrete her house foundation and repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija ya mayor de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 10 años se gana la vida con la venta de cerdos actividad que le permite sostener la economía familiar. Saúl desea comprar cerdos y concentrado para criarlos y luego venderlos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cerdos pequeños y concentrados.
texts.en: Saúl, 45, lives his own house together with his wife and his daughter, already grown. He's a hardworking man who for 10 years has earned a living through the sale of pigs, an activity that allows him to maintain the family finances. Saúl wants to buy pigs and concentrated food to raise them and later sell them, so he asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in small pigs and concentrated food.

loans.use: to invest in small pigs and concentrated food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make cakes.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: Yanira de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 11 años y una de 7 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer que se gana la vida desde hace más de 10 años comprando cerdos para crianza y luego venderlos cuando son adultos, gracias a su amplia experiencia en este oficio Yanira ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes, por lo que desea ampliar su negocio comprando una mayor cantidad de cerdos y alimento, para poder así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Por lo anterior Yanira solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cerdos pequeños y alimento para cerdo como: concentrado y maíz.
texts.en:
Yanira, age 42, lives in her own home with her husband and her 2 children, a little girl, age 11 and another, age 7. 

For more than 10 years, she has been making a living by purchasing pigs, raising and selling them later when they are mature. Thanks to her wide experience in this field, Yanira has a large quantity of customers. That is why she wants to expand her business, purchasing a larger quantity of pigs and feed so that she will be able to fulfill her customers’ requests. 

For this, Yanira is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in small pigs and pig feed, such as concentrate and corn.

loans.use: to invest in small pigs and pig feed, such as concentrate and corn.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.en: Zulola was born in the year 1992. She is married and bringing up a little child. Zulola lives with her husband and child, in the north part of Tajikistan. She is going to organize her own business deal, and in this way, find a source of income. Zulola wants to start a business buying and selling sweets, rolls, and cakes. She will sell sweet products in a local market. With this aim, Zulola took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ offered by a women's organization. She got a certificate. Zulola will be a good business lady, because she is smart. Zulola is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni, which she will use to buy sweets, rolls, and cakes for organizing the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy sweets, rolls, and cakes for organizing the new business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene has been helping at their farm, cultivating and harvesting crops to make a living. Her husband works more on the farm and she earns better income from it. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for plowing and weeding costs. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. In the future, she wants to improve the farm as well as their living situation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is a 19-year-old diploma student majoring in Special Education, and she is in her second year. Her father is a retired man who currently works as a taxi driver. She is seeking to improve her studies to get her Bachelors' degree so that she will find a good job in her field. However she does not have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
After Ebrahim finished paying all the installments of the first loan made by Kiva lenders, he applied for another youth loan of 155,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase cement and steel to finish the renovation of his house and to make the roof for it. 

Ebrahim  warmly thanks Kiva lenders for the first loan. With that loan, he purchased construction materials such as cement, bricks and steel to build his new house. By means of that loan, Ebrahim achieved  most of the building, and he needs another loan to purchase cement and steel to complete the renovation of the house on the inside, and to make the flat roof of the house. 

He is again very thankful and grateful to Kiva lenders for their loan, and hopes to be financed by this loan. He is waiting for your second round of financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cement and steel to finish  the renovation of his house, and to make the roof for it.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 60 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nicanora has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 13 years and also earns an income from general store.

Nicanora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mukhtar Massih

texts.en:
Mukhtar, who is 55, is a hardworking and modest farm worker living in Hyderabad. He currently grows and sells flowers in his nursery. He tends to his plants every day and sells his harvests in the market and to some flower distributors in town. With his enterprising spirit and strength Mukhtar has been making good profits. 

He has requested for a loan to help him buy flowers in bulk. With the support of the loan he will buy flowers at wholesale. Through this he will have a better, more productive harvest, which will improve his income when the time comes to sell his crop.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of flowers for his nursery.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita hails from Maynaguri.  She is an energetic and hardworking woman of 44 years. She has a secondary education. She is a woman with a great mind and good soul. She is the thoughtful mother of one son who is a student of grade 11.  Gita lives in the small village Haspatalpara in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and their only son.

Gita's husband, 56-year-old Amar, is a farmer who tills his small piece of land and grows vegetables.  His scant income is insufficient for the family.  Gita always strives to provide her only son with all things necessary. She dreams that her son will receive higher education.

Gita is associated with the garment business. She purchases varieties of ladies' garments from a wholesale market and sells them in her locality. She sells clothing like sarees, petticoats, blouses, etc.  She has been working with this business for many years and has long experience in this area of business.  Now with the growing demand of her valuable customers, she would like to expand her business.

She would like to renew her assortment of goods, and with this aim, she requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase women's clothing for the new season. As festival season is knocking at the door, she needs more garments stock for their customers. She hopes the expansion of business will earn more profit to provide her family with financial sustenance.  She wants to get ahead with the business for a secured future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti, who is 46 years old and a married woman, lives in the small village of Kathalbari in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district, with her family. Her family comprises her husband Dinabandhu and two sons. She and her husband are illiterate; they can only sign their names. One of her sons is in college, and the other is a day laborer. Her husband also works as a laborer on a daily wages basis.  They have very inconsistent income which is quite insufficient for the family's livelihood.

To give financial help to the family, Jayanti started a dairy business with the purchase of one cow.  She has been supplying milk to her neighbors who are her clients.  Now to earn more for the family, she has decided to expand her business by making and selling milk products such as curd, butter, cottage cheese, etc. She wants to purchase another cow.

So she has asked for a financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner). This new business will be a great support for this hard-working woman, enabling her to increase productivity and live in better conditions.  After the cow is purchased, she will start producing dairy products to sell. They also use the milk products for family feeding. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure a good education for her son so he may progress in life.

This loan will be a great support for the family. Jayanti is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
“Nuevo Horizonte” es un grupo conformado por 11 personas  de las cuales 9 son mujeres y 2 hombres; todos ellos se conocen desde hace ya muchos años puesto que viven en la misma comunidad. En la región,  la principal fuente de empleo es el ingenio, pues se trata de una zona cañera,  también se encuentra uno de los destacamentos de la policía estatal. La recreación principal,  son los juegos de béisbol los días domingo a partir de las 10:00 am en los cuales, la mayoría de las veces el equipo local resulta ganador.

Este grupo de préstamo se originó por la oportunidad que de VisionFund México para considerar a los miembros, candidatos para otorgarles un préstamo con el cual muchos iniciaron su actividad y otros más la expandieron: 

Hilda: Venta De Elotes y Chicharrones 
Hermelinda: Venta De Plata
Carmen: Venta De Cosméticos
Josefina: Venta De Postres
Benigno: Venta De Leña
Juana: Venta cosméticos, hielo y pan
Ana: Venta De Cosméticos
Dorotea: Venta de Tortillas
Pablo: Venta De Dulces
Verónica: Venta De Zapatos 
María: Venta De Zapatos
 
Dorotea tiene 64 años y es viuda. Desde hace nueve años se ha levantado a las 5:00 am para ir al molino y así, siendo las 7 de la mañana ya estén listas las tortillas hechas a mano que vende. Para ella hacer tortillas es una manera de sentirse útil además de que es una actividad que disfruta y genera sus propios ingresos. Doña Dorotea se mantiene ocupada haciendo tortillas, logrando de esta manera ocupar sus pensamientos para no pensar todo el tiempo en su esposo quien ya no está con ella.

Dorotea quisiera utilizar su préstamo para comprar, maíz, cal, un comal  y leña para continuar con su actividad y de esta manera cumplir más ciclos en VisionFund México.
 
*En la imagen: doña Dorotea porta un vestido floreado.
texts.en:
Nuevo Horizonte is a group made up of 11 people. 9 of them are women, and 2 are men. They´ve known each other for a long time, since they all live in the same community. In the region, the main source of work is the ingenuity of the people, because it is a sugar-cane area. There is also a State Police detachment over there. The main amusement is baseball, every Sunday at 10 a.m. The local team wins most of the time.

This loan group started from the opportunity granted by VisionFund Mexico, to consider the members to grant them a loan that some of them used to start their occupations and others to spread it.

Hilda: corn and pork rind sales. 
Hermelinda: silver sales.
Carmen: beauty products sales.
Josefina: dessert sales.
Benigno: firewood sales.
Juana: beauty products, ice, bread sales.
Ana: beauty products sales.
Dorotea: tortillas sales.
Pablo: sweets sales.
Verónica: shoes sales.
María: shoes sales.
 

Dorotea is 64 years old. She is a widow. For 9 years she's been getting up at 5:00 a.m. to go to the mill, that way her handmade tortillas are ready to be sold by 7 a.m. She feels useful making tortillas, she enjoys this occupation and she makes an income. Dorotea keeps busy making tortillas, this is how she keeps her mind busy so she doesn't think all the time about her husband, who is not with her anymore.

 
Dorotea would like to use the loan to buy corn, lime, a griddle, and firewood to keep with her occupation and to be able to complete another cycle with VisionFundMexico.

* In the photo: Dorotea wears a flowered dress.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, a griddle, and firewood.

location.town: Zona Urbana Ejidal, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oax

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en: Emerenciana has been running a buy-and-sell business in order to provide for the needs of her two children. She sells assorted groceries in their village, to make a living. Her husband helps her in operating her business. Aside form this business, the couple was also engaged in their fishing business that they earns more income. To improve sales, she took another loan, which she will use to purchase more groceries to resell. In the future, Emerenciana wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family. Emerenciana was taken picture with their fishing boat used for fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie helps her husband, working in their own farm to make a living. She helps him grow and harvest crops and takes care of boars. This helps to earn additional income for the family. The couple earns enough from their efforts and are able to send their children to school.She had repaid successfully her previous loan, which she used for buying feed. To improve the business, she took a new loan to buy  piglets in order to raise and sell it in the near future.Vergie hopes to improve the business, and she wants to improve the general living of her family, as well.

loans.use: to buy  piglets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Elizabeth is borrowing 19,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 33 years old and single. He is studying, specializing in the field of Education. Jean Claude believes that this loan will help him to secure a high score, because he will not be delayed in paying tuition. (Delayed tuition would result in his suspension from class.)

Jean Claude plans to help his fellow countrymen and women, by educating them, employing the skills he will have obtained at the College of Education.

loans.use: to pay his tuition

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Amos a passionate and hardworking go-getter. He is based in Chebara, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. This area has very bad terrain. Amos is happily married to a beautiful wife and blessed with one child. For the past 6 years he has actively been involved in mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk and eggs. Amos passionately loves farming but the biggest challenge he faces is transportation of the products to the market and timely delivery. Kapsowar area has poor roads and the terrain makes it even worse. He faces challenges transporting his produce especially during the rainy seasons. 

Amos is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Because of poor feeder roads and bad terrain this loan will assist him a great deal. Through the loan he will be able to transport his produce from the farm and deliver it to the market on time. Milk is very perishable and requires quick delivery to the market and through the loan he will be able to make quick deliveries and never suffer losses. Eggs are very fragile and they require proper handling and through the motorbike he will be able to transport his eggs using crates to the market.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports small holder farmers, Amos is assured that his dreams will come to pass. Amos has gone through financial and technical training with Juhudi Kilimo and is confident that through savings from the loan he will improve his living conditions and repay back the loan. Amos plans to impact the society positively through employing someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping him in the field. This loan will be a stepping stone for the success of Amos.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Christopher lives with his beautiful wife in Kitale, a small rural town in Kenya. Kitale area is also referred to as the bread basket area of Kenya because half the food consumed is from that region. He has been farming for the past nine years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, he sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. Christopher is satisfied with the returns he gets through farming. However, he wants to diversify and start horticulture farming and sheep rearing. The main challenge he faces is accessing funds. 

He is kindly requesting a loan to start horticulture farming and sheep rearing. To access funds, Christopher joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo, he answered, “Assist small scale farmers”. Christopher will not just be rearing the ordinary sheep but an exotic breed that produces fine wool and fetches very high prices in the market. Through horticulture and sheep rearing, he will be able to improve his living standards and secure the future of his school-going children. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Christopher is to permanently improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming and sheep rearing

loans.name: Saif

texts.en: Saif is a 21-year-old university student, majoring in Sports Training, and he is in his third year. His father is working at the Accounting Bureau. Saif has been facing some problems in paying his upcoming semester fees, because of the financial crisis his family has been facing. He is planning to get his bachelor's degree so that he will be able to start supporting his family. Now, he is seeking to pay his upcoming semester fees, but he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas is a 21- year-old single university student majoring in Space Engineering and he is in his second year. He also works in the evenings as a cashier at a shopping mall. He is planning to work in his study field after he gets his Bachelor's degree so that he will earn better income. He is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Accounting, and she is in her third year. She lives with her family in Baqaa, Jordan. 

Walaa is seeking to continue her studies until she gets her master's, and to find a good job in the future that brings her a good income. Now, she is seeking a loan that will help her to pay her upcoming semester fees and to continue her journey.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ngome Group

texts.en:
Subira, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who is still at school. She has been a food vendor since 2014.  She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Subira's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to restock the missing items in her food store.  She dreams of opening a salon because she has already bought some salon equipment.  

Subira will share this loan with her loan group "NGOME", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his food store.

loans.name: Doljinsuren

texts.en:
Mr Doljinsuren is a borrower from Tosontsengel, Zavhan province of Mongolia. He lives with his son in a get, a traditional nomadic Mongolian house. His son Batzorig is 20 and studies at the local specialized college. 

He has been farming livestock for several years and started his butcher shop business years ago. He has a lot of experience and respect for livestock. He has been providing healthy and affordable meat products to local customers by purchasing a large number of livestock in spring and rears them until late fall when most Mongolian families start purchasing meat in bulk for winter. Mongolians consume large amounts of meat during winter to overcome the harsh cold weather of Mongolia. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase livestock and resell to local residents.
